Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Omioâ€™s vision is to enable people to travel seamlessly anywhere, anyway. We are bringing all global transport into a single distribution system and creating end-to-end magical consumer journeys.

With Omio you can compare and book trains, buses, ferries and flights anywhere in Europe, the US, and Canada with one simple search, on mobile, app or desktop. By offering transparent pricing and easy booking, Omio makes travel planning simple, flexible and personal.

Omio is the largest source of inventory, with 1000+ suppliers operating in 39 countries. Our brands also include Rome2Rio for global discovery, while Omio powers ticketing and journeys, which attract 900m+ users every year. Our offices are based in Berlin, Prague, Melbourne, Brazil, Bangalore, and London.

We are a growing team of more than 400 passionate employees from more than 50 countries who share the same vision: to create a single tool to help send travellers almost anywhere in the world.

Job Description

The Data team collaborates closely across the business, product, and finance functions, and has a significant impact on setting and delivering on our strategic priorities.

Main Tasks & Responsibilities


Understand Omioâ€™s business model, particularly around the supply of travel inventory across the globe.
Understand and lead on establishing Omioâ€™s top-line metrics and KPIs, reporting their evolution, detecting anomalies, evaluating key drivers, and diagnosing issue root causes.
Build dashboards to support efficient dissemination of the above trends
Build forecasting models to understand gaps in current performance and sales/revenue optimization models to enhance margins without negatively impacting user experience
Perform statistical analyses - including A/B tests and pre/post analyses
Correlate marketing/product/commercial data to derive key insights
Work with our data engineering/business intelligence teams to build data models, which best summarise and utilise our production data
Spot, highlight, and initiate actions on emerging and existing risks related to liabilities and open positions with customers (for example, cancellation liabilities, commission risk, etc.)
Act as an advocate of our companyâ€™s data-driven culture: produce reports that are actionable, dashboards that are diagnostic, and recommendations that drive growth


Qualifications


University degree in Business, Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a similar field; 5+ years of relevant work experience, preferably in e-commerce, consultancy or banking/finance.
Passionate about working with numbers; excellent analytical skills, confidence in working with large data sets and expert in SQL and Excel/Google sheets (R/Python is a plus)
Fluent in English; additional languages are always valued at Omio


Additional Information

Whatâ€™s in it for you?


Have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are changing the way people travel, and you too can have an impact on this ride
A competitive and attractive compensation package
Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
A diverse team of more than 45 nationalities


Diversity makes us stronger

We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all the relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

Recruitment scams: Important notice

Protect yourself from scammers, Omio wants to ensure your ongoing safety during the application process at Omio. Please keep in mind potential scammers impersonating Omio recruiters (mainly via a global professional networking site, and messenger app's).

Remember, Omio never requests payment or sensitive personal information during the recruitment process. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to recruitment@omio.com. Remember to cross-reference against our careers page if you question the authenticity, stay vigilant, and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

Intrigued? Apply here in English.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 80 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive business decisions focusing on supply
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teamsâ€™ product strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


2-4 years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Become a part of our success with virtual stock options
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) Berlin, Hamburg, Munich
Description:
1KOMMA5Â°

We are seeking a Data Analyst with a keen interest in the energy market and a passion for leveraging data to drive impactful decisions. This is an opportunity to work at the intersection of energy innovation, data science, and product development, where your insights will directly shape our growth and mission.

Learn more about our Product & Tech team!

Your mission

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for building and maintaining business dashboards, conducting data analysis, and ensuring data integrity across the organisation. You will act as a bridge between data and various teams, providing stakeholders, including PR, marketing, product, and management, with the insights and numbers they need to steer our organisation effectively. Your role will be pivotal in shaping a data-driven culture and supporting strategic decision-making through high-quality data.

Key Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To


Build and Maintain Dashboards: Design and develop comprehensive business dashboards in Looker to track key metrics such as customer energy usage, segment analysis, customer assets, prices and costs.
Data Analysis and Reporting: Analyse measurements across customer segments to uncover trends, inform pricing strategies, and identify performance and savings opportunities.
Collaboration with Stakeholders: Work closely with PR, marketing, the website team, product teams, and management to communicate and provide accurate, high-quality data for external and internal use.
Ensure Data Integrity: Verify that all data communicated outside the company is accurate, has a strong basis, and meets high standards of quality.
Market Research and Insights: Conduct market research to identify trends, pricing dynamics, and new opportunities, delivering actionable insights that contribute to strategic decision-making.
Support KPI Development: Partner with tech teams to define KPIs for each team, create team dashboards, and ensure alignment with the overall organisational goals.


Data Culture Leadership: Promote a culture of data-driven decision-making within the company by sharing best practices, advocating for data literacy, and fostering innovation in data use.

Your profile

Key Qualifications


Technical Proficiency: Strong experience with SQL and Python for data analysis and pipeline development.
Dashboard Expertise: Demonstrated experience building business dashboards, preferably using Looker or similar tools.
Energy Market Knowledge: A keen interest in the energy market, with previous experience in the sector or product innovation being a plus.
Strong Communication Skills: Ability to clearly communicate data insights and collaborate with cross-functional teams, including non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-Oriented and Organized: Capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring data accuracy and timely delivery of insights.
Strategic Thinking: Ability to analyse market developments and load data to provide insights that enhance product offerings and inform strategic decisions.


Technologies You Will Work With


Google Cloud Platform (GCP): CloudRun, BigQuery, Pub/Sub
SQLMesh, dbt, Airflow
Python and SQL
Looker, Power-Bi, Tableau


Benefits


You are part of a dynamic and highly motivated team with people who have proven that they can make things happen and move companies forward
With your work, you accelerate the "energy and mobility transition" and make a concrete contribution to the sustainable transformation of our energy infrastructure
You move in flat hierarchies and have direct contact with the managing directors as well as short decision-making paths
Work with and learn from other skilled engineers
You work remotely (Germany-wide), with offices in are Hamburg, Berlin or Munich
See the direct impact of your work on a rapid-scaling user base
Create a healthy balance alongside your work and enjoy all the benefits of the EGYM Wellpass


About Us

"At 1KOMMA5Â°, our vision is to accelerate CO2 neutral life for all! We created an easy one-stop-shop to buy and install solar, charging stations and heat pumps, with the purpose of liberating all European homes from the shackles of fossil fuels. With Heartbeat, we make clean energy smarter. Connecting our customers into one powerful clean energy operating system to enable flexible tariffs and to ultimately follow the rhythm of wind and sun!" - Philipp SchrÃ¶der (CEO 1KOMMA5Â°)

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Policy
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 20+ markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

This role will see you become part of the Trust & Safety Domain, with a mission to protect the Vinted community from harmful activities and content. You will investigate, prioritise, and design strategies to fight offences such as fraud and counterfeiting, while also optimising Vinted's policies and related processes.

You will leverage your analytical skills and expertise to drive data-backed decision-making, discover effective solutions against safety issues, design & run experiments, and co-create a safer and more trustworthy platform for our members.

You will also be part of the cross-domain Data Science & Analytics (DSA) guild where you will interact and learn from all data people in Vinted. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation â€“ translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


In this position, youâ€™ll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, or dashboard)
Analyze identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact
Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, target-setting, tracking, and proactively flagging issues
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools
Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyse the results
Help to create a backlog with prioritised hypotheses and analyses


About You


Extensive working experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Scientist or a related position
A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Excellent written and spoken English
Strong analytical, strategic, and business skills
A degree in statistics, physics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar field
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
Fluency in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Advantage: experience with working cloud data configuration (e.g., AWS, BigQuery)
Advantage: experience working in a tech company or in a cross-functional product development team


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to â‚¬540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.

Hybrid Work

Weâ€™ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. Itâ€™s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days youâ€™ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is â‚¬ 69,000 - â‚¬ 93,400 gross per year.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:

Title: Data Analyst/Market Researcher
Description:
Job Description

Responsibilities:


Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscapes, and growth opportunities.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights and inform business decisions.
Develop and maintain comprehensive databases and dashboards to track key performance indicators and metrics.
Generate reports, presentations, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategies and initiatives based on research findings.
Stay current on market developments, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and market research.


Requirements:


Bachelorâ€™s degree in business, economics, statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
Proven experience as a data analyst, market researcher, or similar role, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.


What We Offer:


Competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance and retirement savings options.
Flexible work schedule and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the United States.
Professional development opportunities, including training and certifications to support your career growth.
A supportive and collaborative team environment where your contributions are valued and recognized.

Title: (Junior) BI Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
We are looking for an ambitious (Junior) BI Analyst (m/f/d)

(unlimited, full-time)




Join our team at our location in Verl, Baden-Baden, Mainz, Berlin or Oslo â€“ flexible working conditions available.




We are currently on the lookout for a BI Analyst to join our BI Analysis team. Our team is responsible for the development and improvement of our BI self-service solutions, as well as requirement gathering from our internal stakeholders and communication with data engineers. As a BI Analyst, you will work closely with our colleagues in Finance and Data Engineering, and learn a lot about our data sources and processes.




As a BI Analyst, you will:

Act as the interface between our internal business stakeholders and our Data & Analytics organization
Support in building, maintaining, and improving Power BI apps and dashboards
Work on quality assurance and testing of new features, bug fixes, and data model improvements
Design, build, and maintain business-critical dashboards with Power BI technology based on a modern Data Lakehouse
Work in cross-functional teams with travel opportunities to our European offices
Provide advice on various aspects, including information design (e.g., IBCS) and data storytelling




What you should bring:

MSc/MBA in Business Analysis, Finance, or technical subjects
High affinity for and first experience in Business Analysis, e.g., relevant internships
Good knowledge of SQL
Experience with Power BI, Tableau, or similar reporting tools is a plus
Excellent knowledge of English; a second language (e.g., Norwegian or German) is a plus
Basic knowledge of DAX language is a clear advantage




We are looking for these traits:

Analytical, with a creative, structured, and logical approach
Detail-oriented and able to work both independently and in a team
Excellent communication skills
Comfortable working in a constantly changing environment




Benefits:

At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
SLAY, founded in December 2022, has swiftly made its mark in the mobile world. In 2023, we developed several apps and games that reached the #1 spot in the App Store across 3 continents.

Backed by some of the world's most esteemed investors, including Accel, Kevin Weil, Riccardo Zacconi Scott Belsky, and Ilkka Paananen, SLAY is rapidly growing and reaching millions of users.

Our mission is to create digital life through AI and become the leading company for virtual friends that live, grow and evolve like humansâ€”starting with Pengu. Pengu has become the biggest AI character app with its own IP in the US and Europe.

Tasks


Data Analysis and Insights: Enable tactical and strategic decision-making by providing insightful analyses, developing predictive models, and creating dashboards.
Predictive Analytics: Build and interpret predictive models to forecast Lifetime Value (LTV) and user behavior, optimizing marketing spend and strategies.
Attribution Modeling: Implement and refine attribution modelsâ€”including probabilistic and multi-touch modelsâ€”working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data and other privacy-centric attribution methods.
A/B Testing: Design, analyze, and interpret the results of A/B tests to inform marketing strategies and improve campaign performance.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, user acquisition, and data engineering teams to understand data needs and deliver solutions that drive business objectives.



Requirements

Experience:


3+ years in a role such as Data Analyst or Data Scientist with a strong emphasis on marketing analytics.
Currently employed in a gaming company, actively addressing similar challenges is a plus.



Technical Proficiency:


Strong expertise in SQL and experience with data analysis tools.
Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Python or R).
Experience with cloud data warehouses is a plus.



Predictive Analytics:


Experience with predictive modeling techniques and forecasting LTV.
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and algorithms relevant to marketing analytics.



Attribution Modeling:


Strong knowledge of attribution models, including probabilistic and multi-touch models.
Familiarity with mobile attribution challenges like SKAdNetwork (SKAN).



Data Visualization:


Proficiency with visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, or Power BI.



Marketing Knowledge:


Deep understanding of performance marketing, user acquisition strategies, and performance metrics (e.g., CPI, CPA, ROAS, K-factor).



Analytical Mindset:


Strong problem-solving skills and a data-driven approach.
Ability to handle complex datasets and extract actionable insights.



Communication Skills:


Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.



Adaptability:


Proven ability to deliver high-quality results in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.

Show more

Title: Working Student Data Analyst (x/f/m)
Description:
As a Working Student Data Analyst (F/X/M), you have a unique opportunity to revolutionize the financial industry. With our platform Pulsproject we enable SMEs to get business loans without the hassle of a complicated bank check. In our highly dedicated and motivated team, you will analyze our customer data. Join our team in Berlin and start your career at a young and dynamic FinTech company.

Tasks


Data collection and cleansing: Collect, cleanse, and organize data from multiple sources to ensure data quality and completeness.
Data analysis: Analyze data using data analysis tools to identify trends, patterns, and outliers.
Data Interpretation: understandably interpret results and provide clear recommendations for action to team members and customers.
Quality Assurance: Perform data quality checks and validations to ensure data integrity.



Requirements


You are currently studying for a Bachelor's (last year) or Master's degree in the field of Computer science / Finance / Business Analytics in Berlin.
Proficiency with data analysis tools and software such as Excel.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and find creative solutions.
Fluent in written and spoken English, with German language skills rounding out the profile.
Attention to detail and commitment to high-quality work.
Ability to work as part of a team and adapt to changing priorities.



Benefits


Learn from a incredibly talented team of smart, international individuals who are always ready to learn, discover, and implement
An environment that offers room for personal and professional development
A centrally located office in Berlin City West
Being part of a fearless pioneering company that relentlessly strives for new technological breakthroughs
The opportunity to work with smart and passionate people to develop fantastic products
A pet-friendly environment
Salary progression based on length of service with the company
Challenging projects. Exceptional experiences.



At Puls Technologies GmbH, we're not just offering a job; we're inviting you to be part of an exhilarating expedition that is reshaping the very fabric of the SME landscape. If you're passionate about driving growth, igniting innovation, and leaving a lasting impact, your adventure begins here!

You will work with an enthusiastic team of smart, talented people in the heart of Berlin's City West.

Get in touch with us now!

Puls Technologies GmbH

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Digital Marketing
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 20+ markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

At Vinted, our Digital Marketing Data Science & Analytics team is pivotal in driving growth through data-driven decision-making and enabling high-stake investment decisions. This team comprises talented individuals with backgrounds in academia, econometrics, e-commerce, consulting, and media. They use scientific approaches to solve complex business problems, develop statistical and business models, perform advanced data analyses, and ensure data reliability.

Within Marketing, we currently have exciting opportunities for Decision Scientists to work with either CRM or Performance Marketing teams.

Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) department we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation â€“ translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.


In this position, youâ€™ll


Set up untracked marketing experiments: Use Geo experiments, causal impact, or diff-in-diff methodologies to measure the incremental impact of different marketing channels and campaigns
Experimentation: Analyse AB tests and iterate on the experiment set up and automated testing tools
Revenue Stream Analysis: Investigate revenue streams generated by marketing, including acquisition, reactivation, and engagement.
Marketing Channel Analysis: Assess the impact of various marketing channels on user acquisition, retention, engagement, and revenue.
Support Media Mix Modeling: Occasionally assist with ad-hoc requests, including data questions, consultations, and analyses.
Segmentation: Develop unique personas to enable relevant and personalised comms to millions of Vinted users
Analytical deep dives: answer complex questions such as: when is the best time to reach out to our customers? What is the best mix of different messages and amount of communications? What is the total impact of all communications?


About You

General Requirements:


Several years of experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role.
Strong business results orientation with the ability to connect scientific approaches with pragmatic problem-solving.
Excellent communication skills to present results persuasively to various stakeholders.
Proficiency in at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Stata, Matlab, etc.)
Fluency in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau).
A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business, or a related field.
Excellent written and spoken English.


Nice To Have Skills (not All Necessary)


Strong experimentation knowledge from CRM or Product background;
Good understanding of performance marketing channels attribution;
Causal inference and geo experimentation experience


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to â‚¬540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.

Hybrid Work

Weâ€™ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. Itâ€™s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days youâ€™ll spend working together in person.

Show more
HTML:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 20+ markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

At Vinted, our Digital Marketing Data Science & Analytics team is pivotal in driving growth through data-driven decision-making and enabling high-stake investment decisions. This team comprises talented individuals with backgrounds in academia, econometrics, e-commerce, consulting, and media. They use scientific approaches to solve complex business problems, develop statistical and business models, perform advanced data analyses, and ensure data reliability.

Within Marketing, we currently have exciting opportunities for Decision Scientists to work with either CRM or Performance Marketing teams.

Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) department we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:

  • Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
  • Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
  • Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation â€“ translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.

In this position, youâ€™ll

  • Set up untracked marketing experiments: Use Geo experiments, causal impact, or diff-in-diff methodologies to measure the incremental impact of different marketing channels and campaigns
  • Experimentation: Analyse AB tests and iterate on the experiment set up and automated testing tools
  • Revenue Stream Analysis: Investigate revenue streams generated by marketing, including acquisition, reactivation, and engagement.
  • Marketing Channel Analysis: Assess the impact of various marketing channels on user acquisition, retention, engagement, and revenue.
  • Support Media Mix Modeling: Occasionally assist with ad-hoc requests, including data questions, consultations, and analyses.
  • Segmentation: Develop unique personas to enable relevant and personalised comms to millions of Vinted users
  • Analytical deep dives: answer complex questions such as: when is the best time to reach out to our customers? What is the best mix of different messages and amount of communications? What is the total impact of all communications?

About You

General Requirements:

  • Several years of experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role.
  • Strong business results orientation with the ability to connect scientific approaches with pragmatic problem-solving.
  • Excellent communication skills to present results persuasively to various stakeholders.
  • Proficiency in at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Stata, Matlab, etc.)
  • Fluency in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau).
  • A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business, or a related field.
  • Excellent written and spoken English.

Nice To Have Skills (not All Necessary)

  • Strong experimentation knowledge from CRM or Product background;
  • Good understanding of performance marketing channels attribution;
  • Causal inference and geo experimentation experience

Work perks

  • The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
  • 30 days of paid annual leave
  • Newest MacBook models
  • Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
  • Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to â‚¬540 for home workplace furniture
  • A daily lunch allowance
  • Frequent team-building events
  • A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
  • A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
  • A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
  • Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
  • Life and disability insurance provided
  • A subsidised Deutschlandticket
  • The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
  • A dog-friendly office

Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.

Hybrid Work

Weâ€™ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. Itâ€™s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days youâ€™ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is â‚¬ 57,000 - â‚¬ 77,100 gross per year.

Title: Data Analyst/Market Researcher
Description:
Job Description

Responsibilities:


Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscapes, and growth opportunities.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights and inform business decisions.
Develop and maintain comprehensive databases and dashboards to track key performance indicators and metrics.
Generate reports, presentations, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategies and initiatives based on research findings.
Stay current on market developments, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and market research.


Requirements:


Bachelorâ€™s degree in business, economics, statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
Proven experience as a data analyst, market researcher, or similar role, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.


What We Offer:


Competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance and retirement savings options.
Flexible work schedule and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the United States.
Professional development opportunities, including training and certifications to support your career growth.
A supportive and collaborative team environment where your contributions are valued and recognized.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
As a Marketing BI Analyst (m/f/d) in the Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team, you will be primarily responsible for generating and preparing data-driven insights for our marketing, service, and sales activities. By aggregating, analyzing, and visualizing data from various sources, you will play a key role in optimizing our customer journey, enhancing the efficiency of our marketing and lead generation campaigns, improving call center management processes, and supporting strategic decision-making.

Your impact


Conducting customer journey analyses using Global Digital Marketing data to identify trends and derive actionable recommendations.
Developing, maintaining, and optimizing dashboards and reports in Power BI and Google Sheets for KPI visualization and monitoring.
Automating and optimizing data processes while ensuring data quality using Python, SQL, and Databricks.
Supporting central and global marketing teams with planning, forecasting, and ongoing monitoring of their target KPIs.
Creating country-specific analyses to drive growth and optimize the use of digital marketing channels in individual markets.
Collaborating closely with the Data Engineering and Data Science teams within Viessmann IT.
Preparing results in the form of presentations, reports, and summaries for relevant stakeholders.


Who You Are


A completed degree in business administration, economics, data science, or a comparable analytical field.
Several years of professional experience in business intelligence, data analytics, CRM, or a similar analytical area.
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of statistics and data modeling.
Extensive experience with tools like Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks, and ideally Python, SQL, or similar technologies.
Experience in analyzing CRM, call center, and/or performance marketing data.
Ability to effectively prepare and present complex data in an understandable and impactful way.
Independent, structured working style and enjoyment of working in an international, cross-functional team.
Language skills in German and English (at least Level B2).


Even if you don't fulfill all of the above but are ready to take this challenge on as a next step, go ahead and press â€œApplyâ€ anyway. We love your spirit!

What Makes Us Special

Our employees are the key to make our vision come alive. With that in mind, weâ€˜ve created a range of perks for our employees:


A permanent position awaits you at our business where new technologies meet a modern workplace culture.
Viessmann Climate Solutions offers 30 days of paid vacation a year.
Once you join Viessmann, you can refer other great candidates and receive a referral bonus if they are hired.
Enjoy cool exclusive discounts on selected Viessmann Climate Solutions products and services.
Need a quick energy boost? Free healthy snacks and drinks are provided for you.
For a healthier community: Our health program offers easy access to coaching and therapy for our employees and their families.
Whether commuting by Job Bike or travelling by Europcar - our partnerships will protect the environment and your wallet.
The Viessmann academy and external partners offer a wide range of professional and personal training opportunities.
Whenever possible, Viessmann offers the option of mobile working and also provides the needed technical equipment.
Celebrate and have a great time with your co-workers at our individualized events, like our monthly breakfast or other team events.
Our flexible working hours allow you to balance your work and private life.
Daycare center or school closed? No problem! Your child will find toys and enough space to play-- and you have a fully equipped workplace to work in our child-parent room.


Who We Are

We are Viessmann Climate Solutions. Founded in 1917 as a heating technology manufacturer, and now part of Carrier, we are today one of the world's leading providers of efficient and systemic climate and renewable energy solutions. We cover all applications: heating, cooling, ventilation, water and air quality, energy generation, and energy storage for the residential and commercial sector.

Our integrated solution offering seamlessly connects products and systems via digital platforms and services to a holistic climate and energy solution, thus creating a safe and reliable feel-good climate for our users. All activities are driven by our company purpose, "We create living spaces for generations to come" and our employees are passionate about playing an active role in the energy transition. Join us on this exciting journey now.

Title: CRM Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalandoâ€™s Markets organization, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer focussed analytics and segmentations we put our customers at the center of every marketing and retail decision. As a (Senior) Customer Data Analyst in our Customer Segmentation Team you are the closest link to our customer You build a deep understanding of our customer base by developing and analyzing different customer segments based on their purchasing behavior, interests, customer value and onsite activities. You will transform data and segmentations into actionable insights and recommendations that drive strategic decisions and customer retention.

WHAT WEâ€™D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



Develop and analyze customer segmentations and audiences, support targeting and steering initiatives to drive customer value and retention. Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to optimize and productionalize your segmentations and audience selections.
Design, conduct and evaluate A/B tests to optimize your segmentations and audiences according to their use case. Recommend testing strategies to optimize targeted campaigns, campaign efficiency and ultimately customer value and retention. Translate complex questions into sound analytical tasks, autonomously planning large scale projects.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify new strategic opportunities and recommend actions supporting the customer strategy. Present your findings and work closely with business stakeholders and product owners to operationalize your recommendations.
Drive data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members in terms of methodology & technology to raise the bar within the department. Collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers and commercial colleagues to untap new sources of data and know-how.
Independently manage analytical projects, identifying efficiency opportunities and supporting decision-making with insights from descriptive and inferential analysis.
Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions, support junior colleagues, and contribute to internal events and the hiring process.



WEâ€™D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



You have 3+ years experience in using customer data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions and/or drive targeting efforts incl. model driven statistical analysis, e.g. Causal Inference. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science.
Advanced skills in data methodologies and technologies (Python and SQL, PySpark). Visualization tools, e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, PowerBI and versioning tools, e.g. Git/GitHub, are considered a plus. Curious about learning new technologies, e.g. Databricks, AWS data lake, Airflow.
Strong communicator to challenge the status-quo, tell data stories, maximize decision impact of your results and liaison with commercial and tech people alike.
Proactive, fast learner, problem solver, teamplayer, comfortable working in English in a fast paced international work environment



INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
Your mission

Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist at Cloover, youâ€™ll play a pivotal role in supporting teams across the companyâ€”including finance, sales, and marketingâ€”by providing actionable data insights and helping us achieve our climate goals. Your responsibilities include:


Supporting the design, testing, and refinement of credit risk models and portfolio analytics that drive renewable energy financing.
Analyzing and optimizing large datasets stored in Google BigQuery to uncover trends and enable data-driven decision-making.
Building and maintaining dashboards in Metabase for monitoring key performance metrics (KPIs) across finance, sales, and marketing.
Conducting data exploration to uncover actionable insights for business strategy and renewable energy project financing.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop predictive models, automate data pipelines, and integrate new datasets.
Helping the sales and marketing teams identify customer patterns, improve conversion rates, and optimize campaign performance.
Preparing visualizations and reports to communicate insights to internal teams and external stakeholders, including lenders and investors.


Your profile


You are a student or recent graduate of a top-tier university in data science, statistics, computer science, finance, or a related field.
Proficiency in at least one programming or query language such as Python, SQL, or R; expertise in all is not required but is a bonus.
A strong foundation in statistics, probability, and machine learning concepts.
Previous experience (internships or academic projects) with data analysis, financial modeling, or credit risk is highly valued.
Knowledge of financial markets, debt instruments, or renewable energy systems is an advantage.
Excellent problem-solving skills with attention to detail and a drive to take ownership of tasks.
Fluency in English; German is a plus, but not required.
Passion for climate action and an eagerness to contribute to solutions that make a tangible impact.
Availability for a 3-6 month internship, starting as soon as possible.


Why us?


Work out with an Urban Sports membership.
Fast career advancement opportunities with the right performance.
Central office location in Berlin.
An international working environment; exposure to Triple-A investors.


About Us

At Cloover, our mission is to empower 1 billion people to become part of the sustainable world of tomorrow by providing hassle-free access to renewable energy at the click of a button. Join the race to achieve Net Zero and enable everyone to play a role in the energy transition.

Weâ€™re building the OS for renewable energy installers, streamlining their operations from financing to working capital management. Our platform enables providers of renewable technologies to offer embedded financing options to their customers, empowering more individuals and businesses to install solar panels, battery storage, EV charging stations, and heat pumps, transforming them into independent energy suppliers.

We aim to make sustainable financing simpler, faster, and more affordable, bringing renewable energy to every household and business.

We are on an exciting growth journey, currently operating in the Netherlands, Sweden, Switzerland, and Germany, with plans to expand to additional European markets in the coming year.

Title: Data Analyst - EU Marketing
Description:
About The Team

We are on a mission to build the ultimate go-to-market engine. To help us to achieve our mission, we are seeking a Data Analyst to strengthen the Global Analytics Team and support SumUp's strategic Marketing initiatives. This role partners with Marketing leadership to identify business needs, then construct data models, generate reports and dashboards, offer advanced analysis and actionable insights to drive improvement in our online channels. You will make a significant contribution to the business by being a valued business partner, a member of an experienced data team and by actively participating in the development of the analytics chapter.

What you'll do:


Create efficient data models that track Online Marketing funnel performance and KPIs, from ad spend to product activation.
Use data to drive analysis and actionable recommendations to shape Marketing program design, operations, and strategy
Partner with Marketing leadership and Strategic Finance to set performance targets, define KPIs, create scalable reporting and forecasts, and provide insight to drivers of pacing against goals
Collaborate closely with Senior Leadership to develop and evaluate Marketing strategies based on data-aware insights and qualitative analysis
Develop advanced dashboards to facilitate self-service analytics for the Marketing teams as well as SumUp Leadership
Drive strategic data OKRs aligned with SumUp's business goals, such as ICP analysis and readout
Partner with Analytics Engineers to ensure that data is properly collected, stored, processed, and accessible for analytics


Youâ€™ll be great for this role if you have:


2â€“4 years of experience in an analytical role at a high-growth tech company, including at least 1 year of hands-on experience with data analytics, data model design, dbt, and collaborative development using Git
Hands-on experience in developing advanced dashboards following industry best practices, preferably using Tableau
The ability to analyze Online Marketing and GTM needs and turn them into KPIs, insights, data models, and dashboards
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to identify trends and key insights from unclear data.
Excellent communication skills and a strategic mindset to effectively collaborate with leadership
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to apply quantitative analysis and logical reasoning to inform and influence business decisions


Why you should join SumUp:

ðŸŒ Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup.

ðŸŒˆ Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced

ðŸ“š A dedicated annual L&D budget of â‚¬2,000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education.

ðŸš€ Enrolment onto our VSOP program: You will own a stake in SumUpâ€™s future success

ðŸ’¶ A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions

ðŸ”„ 30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30 days sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp.

ðŸ”— Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team.

ðŸšµðŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, subsidised office lunches.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by Company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

About us:

SumUp is a leading financial technology company, founded in 2012 with the goal of empowering small businesses around the globe. Weâ€™re the financial partner of choice for more than 4 million merchants in over 35 markets. We collectively build, plan and fine-tune the technology that drives SumUp and empowers small businesses around the world.

We believe in the everyday hero. Those who have the courage to follow their passion and who have the strength and determination to realise their dreams. Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their business. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first attitude' our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that small business owners can be successful doing what they love.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you donâ€™t tick every box, itâ€™s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Title: Manufacturing Data Analyst
Description:
Your role

In This Role You Will


Leverage artificial intelligence to drive operational excellence in our customers
Work closely with our consulting and technical teams to actively identify solutions to increase efficiency, improve ergonomics, and reduce costs within our customersâ€™ manufacturing processes
Combine traditional Lean Management and Six Sigma methods with artificial intelligence to drive process optimization
Analyze processes and business data to support strategic decisions and calculate their monetary impact
Monitor and report the progress of process improvement initiatives including their actual monetary business impact
Create and maintain process documentation and standards using Deltiaâ€™s AI software


Your profile

Requirements


Enrolled or recently graduate from a Masterâ€™s program in Business Administration, Information Systems, Engineering or a related field
1+ years of experience in a startup or consultancy environment
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact effectively with team members and clients
Experience in analyzing and optimizing business processes
Dedication and drive in solving customer problems
Strong analytical skills and experience using data analysis tools (e.g., Power BI) and with SQL
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel for data analysis
Fluent written and spoken English skills; German is a plus


Nice-to-have


Knowledge of project management and process improvement methods such as Lean Management and Six Sigma
Experience in the manufacturing industry is an advantage, but not essential
Experience with Python or R is a plus


What We Offer


A competitive salary and stock options
Be on the forefront in defining what artificial intelligence means in manufacturing
Gain hands-on experience in working in an AI-first software company
The option to work in a brand new office situated on the AI Campus in Berlin where we closely cooperate with other exciting AI ventures
Work remotely from anywhere in Europe
Supportive and inclusive culture that values diversity and promotes the advancement of underrepresented groups within the company
Collaborate with a diverse (currently more than 10 nationalities) and talented team, working on cutting-edge projects with real-world impact
Network with professionals and leaders in the field, opening doors to potential future career opportunities
Ethicsâš–ï¸: We are committed to developing ethical AI software


About Us

We're a dynamic AI startup reshaping manufacturing with advanced tech like computer vision and AI. Our mission? Empower workers to boost productivity using cutting-edge tools. Starting with assembly processes, we'll expand to logistics and more.

Led by Max, who digitized 40 factories, and Silviu, a computer vision expert, our team includes top talent from ETH, MIT, and industry leaders. We value hard work, creativity, and diversity. Backed by Merantix and Cavalry, we offer comprehensive benefits, flexible schedules, and a supportive work environment.

Join us on the Berlin AI Campus, part of a vibrant ecosystem of engineers and entrepreneurs from top universities worldwide.

Title: Data Analyst / Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
SafeDriver Group GmbH is a leading company in the field of safe passenger transportation and an important service partner for innovative mobility companies and global players. With over 800 dedicated employees, we implement pioneering mobility solutions in Germany's urban centers. As a growing company, we are looking for an experienced and analytically strong personality to advance our group of companies as a Data Analyst / Data Engineer (m/f/d).

Aufgaben


Building a data warehouse for efficient storage, management, and analysis of business data.
Performing data analysis and visualization with tools such as backends Google Cloud, AWS, Python, R, SQL, Tableau and Power BI.
Implementing machine learning models to predict business outcomes and optimize processes.
Analyzing large data sets to derive business trends and patterns.
Creating dashboards and reports to present insights to stakeholders.
Collaborating with internal and external teams to implement data-driven projects.
Performing Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) for data cleansing and preparation.
Development of statistical models and implementation of predictive models with Python libraries such as Pandas, NumPy and scikit-learn or similar.
Experience with ETL processes (Extract, Transform, Load) and data pipelines an advantage.



Qualifikation


Degree in data science, information technology, business informatics or a related field (e.g. B.Sc. in Data Analytics, B.Sc. in International Economics & Management).
Practical experience in data analysis, data visualization and working with databases (SQL, NoSQL, Big Query).
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python, R and SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Excel.
Experience with graph-based databases such as Neo4j or tools for processing unstructured data (e.g. Apache Kafka) is a plus.
Familiarity with machine learning and statistics (e.g. time series analysis, regression models).
Strong analytical thinking skills and ability to solve complex data problems.
Experience working with diverse stakeholders and the ability to make complex technical concepts understandable to non-technical teams.
Language skills: Fluent in English (C1), basic knowledge of German (B1 an advantage).



Benefits


A responsible position in a growing company with a lot of creative freedom.
A dynamic and challenging working environment with the opportunity to work on exciting projects.
The opportunity to actively shape strategic decisions and support the company on its growth path.
A dynamic and motivated team, as well as short decision-making paths.
Attractive remuneration and development opportunities.
Training opportunities and support for professional development.



We look forward to receiving your complete application documents including your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date.

  • Unbefristeter Vertrag nach 6-monatiger Probezeit
  • Raum zur Entfaltung und zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten in deiner neuen Rolle
  • JÃ¤hrliches Weiterbildungsbudget mit individuellem Gestaltungsspielraum


Wir freuen uns Ã¼ber deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins an talent@tlgg.de.

Title: Digital Analytics Internship
Description:
JOIN OUR AMSTERDAM DIGITAL ANALYTICS TEAM!

We believe that data is one of the most important resources, that enables us to better understand our consumer, enhance their experience and connect them to their passion. In the Digital Analytics team, we create fact-based insights through a holistic, integrated, and actionable storytelling approach across all relevant digital marketing initiatives to help improve and shape our future digital publishing and media plans, tactics, content strategies and brand narratives.

Grow Your Capabilities Through Meaningful Tasks And Projects

DIGITAL ANALYTICS: Digital Analytics Team is responsible for delivering cutting-edge analytics services to internal stakeholders, enabling them to make fact-based decisions. We manage the generation of insights that help adidas understand consumer behavior and performance related analytics to ultimately help drive sales.

DIGITAL PARTNER ANALYTICS: Collaborate with the various Partner and Wholesale teams to capture reporting requirements and support Analytics team to implement these.

Support the Analytics team enhancing the backend structure of our performance dashboards. Pro-actively seek for new reporting opportunities to provide our teams additional performance insights.

WHAT WOULD MAKE YOU A MATCH?


Student of Business, Engineering, Data Analytics, Computer Sciences or equivalent
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills in combination with a strategic way of thinking
First experiences in project management beneficial
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Hands-on working style to get things done, ability to work under pressure to meet critical deadlines
Agile, open-minded team player with a passion for sports and lifestyle
Eagerness to continuously improve oneself and to further develop own skills
Fluent in English
Affinity to digital tools
Strong MS Office skills (especially PowerPoint and Excel)
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python and PowerBI



Requirements


Enrolled as full-time student for the complete duration of the internship
Candidates in penultimate year of study preferred (following the internship, students should have maximum one year to graduate)
Availability for the full duration of the internship from March 2025 - September 2025
Local to Amsterdam/Ability to relocate to Amsterdam for the full duration of the internship



Benefits


Employee discounts on products
Chances to attend and take part in on campus events and sponsored events/games
Structured training and development, access to LinkedIn Learning, Language Training and Learning Portal
Possibility to join our mentorship program, networking opportunities or employee resource groups
International intern community and work environment
Regular development conversations as part of your role
Inspiring campus with canteens, cafes, reflection rooms and sport facilities including an on-site gym (free)
Company events focusing on sports and mental health
Flexible and agile working arrangements (40% home office possible)
Monthly gross allowance: 1.200,00â‚¬
Show more

Gestaltung und Entwicklung der zugrunde liegenden Datenstrukturen sowie der zugehÃ¶rigen ETL-Prozesse, die eine stabile Basis fÃ¼r unsere Dashboards bieten.
Definition und Implementierung von Standards fÃ¼r die DatenqualitÃ¤t, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere LÃ¶sungen hohen Anforderungen an Data Governance gerecht werden.
Arbeit in einem agilen Teamumfeld und enge Abstimmung mit den Produkt- und Entwicklerteams, um unser Analytics Modul und unsere Dashboards iterativ weiterzuentwickeln.

Abgeschlossenes Studium mit analytischem Schwerpunkt (BWL, VWL, Mathematik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik o.Ã¤.) oder in dem Bereich Bauingenieurwesen
Mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Business Intelligence, Data Analytics oder Controlling.
Fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL und Datenbankabfragen (z. B. SQL-Server).
Erfahrung mit ETL-Tools (z. B. Microsoft Fabric, Talend).
Kenntnisse in statistischer Datenanalyse (z. B. mit Python) sind wÃ¼nschenswert.
Kreative Ideen und Begeisterung fÃ¼r die Gestaltung und Weiterentwicklung von Dashboards und Reports.
AusgeprÃ¤gte KommunikationsfÃ¤higkeiten, um effektiv mit unseren Stakeholdern zusammenzuarbeiten.
Sprachkenntnisse: Englisch auf mindestens B2-Niveau und gute Deutschkenntnisse

Motiviert durch unsere Werte & Vision, treiben wir die digitale Transformation bei unseren Kunden voran â€“ fÃ¼r ein digitales, effizienteres und nachhaltigeres Ingenieur- und Bauwesen. â€žBuilding Better Togetherâ€œ ist fÃ¼r uns mehr als ein Slogan. Denn neben unseren Kunden stehst du im Vordergrund. Damit du deine Leidenschaft fÃ¼r deine Aufgaben voll entfalten kannst, unterstÃ¼tzen wir dich durch:


einen strukturierten Start: individuelles Onboarding, organisiertes Networking
Goodies wie: MitarbeitervergÃ¼nstigungen (z.B. Corporate Benefits), PrÃ¤mien (z.B. zur Hochzeit, Geburt, JubilÃ¤um), Aktienbeteiligung Schneider Electric, Mitarbeiterevents (Teamevents, Sommerfeste, â€¦), je nach Standort: Tischkicker/ Tischtennisplatte/ Hunde geduldet, Gesundheitsmanagement (z.B. VergÃ¼nstigungen im Sportstudio, Betriebsarzt, â€¦),...

Karriereentwicklung/ -perspektiven: Team- bzw. Rollenbasierte Weiterentwicklung/ Trainings, individuelle Weiterentwicklung/ Trainings, nationale und internationale Karriereperspektiven innerhalb der RIB-Gruppe oder Schneider Electric, â€¦
deinen Raum fÃ¼r GestaltungsmÃ¶glichkeiten: proaktives Teilen deiner Ideen/ AnsÃ¤tze/ Prozessoptimierungen innerhalb des Teams, betriebliches Ideenmanagement, aktive Beteiligung an Meetings auf Team und Managementebene (â€žRIB Town Hallsâ€œ), â€¦
Wege, wie du nachhaltig sein kannst (je nach Standort & Funktion): digitale Infrastruktur, Company-Bikes, Fahrtkostenzuschuss, eAuto als Firmenwagen


UNTERNEHMENSKULTUR UND WERTE

Motiviert durch unsere Werte kreiren wir eine Unternemenskultur, in der wir ein klares Bild davon haben, wie wir miteinander interargieren, kommunizieren, arbeiten, fÃ¼hren/ coachen, supporten und unseren Nachwuchs fÃ¶rdern. Dabei steht immer der Mensch im Vordergrund!

CHANCENGLEICHHEIT UND DIVERSITY

RIB fÃ¶rdert die Chancengleichheit von Frauen und MÃ¤nnern in allen Funktionen und TÃ¤tigkeitsfeldern.

Ganz gleich ob weibliche FÃ¼hrungskrÃ¤fte, Mitarbeitende mit Behinderung, Berufseinsteigenden oder Ã¤ltere Berufserfahrene â€“ fÃ¼r uns zÃ¤hlt Engagement und die richtige Qualifikation. Der RIB Code of Conduct beschreibt dabei unsere wichtigsten Prinzipien in puncto NationalitÃ¤t, ethnischer Herkunft, Religion,â€¦

RIB VISION

GebÃ¤ude und Bauten sind fÃ¼r 36% des weltweiten Energieverbrauchs und fast 40% der energiebedingten CO2-Emissionen verantwortlich. Um die Branche effizienter, robuster und nachhaltiger zu machen, entwickeln wir SoftwarelÃ¶sungen, mit denen man im gesamten Lebenszyklus eines Bauwerks Ressourcen, Rohstoffe und Energie einsparen kann. Digitalisierung sehen wir als einen Treiber fÃ¼r eine nachhaltige Bauindustrie. Title: Analyst (m/f/d) - Renewable Energy
Description:
Company information:

GoldenPeaks Capital Trading is the commercial branch of GoldenPeaks Capital Holding, responsible for offtake structuring, Power Purchase Agreementsâ€™ (PPA) negotiations and commercialization of renewable production.




GoldenPeaks Capital is one of the fastest-growing independent green power producers in Eastern Europe. Fundamental to our ongoing success is broad value chain integration and consolidation at GoldenPeaks Capital. This ensures continuous success in reaching ambitious targets, due to a unique alignment of vision, planning and know-how.




We strive to promote renewable energy by offering innovative technologic as well as commercial solutions. We are aiming to develop, invest, build, and maintain our own large scale renewable power plants.




In the role as an Analyst, you will play a pivotal part in optimizing the companyâ€™s revenues by conducting market analysis, assessing risks, building market intelligence, and developing strategies and products to manage the portfolio and exposures effectively. You will leverage your analytical skills, attention to detail, and technical expertise to provide actionable insights. Collaboration with Portfolio Management, Origination, and external counterparties will be essential to your success.




Responsibilites include (but are not limited to):

Evaluate new business cases, including implementing new technologies, entering new markets, and launching new products.
Build and maintain a market intelligence framework to support data-driven decision-making.
Collaborate with Portfolio Management and Origination to identify, analyse, and implement opportunities to optimize risk-weighted revenues.
Monitor market developments and regulatory changes, reporting on potential impacts to the business.
Analyse and manage large datasets to uncover insights and drive enhanced decision-making processes.
Develop and maintain tools or models using programming languages like Python for business analysis.
Design and manage database queries and operations; experience with SQL or Azure platforms is a strong advantage.




Qualifications:

Essential:

Bachelorâ€™s degree (or higher) in economics, finance, engineering, computer science, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in an analytical and/or business development role, ideally in the energy industry.
Commercial mindset with strong analytical and attention-to-detail skills.
Experience in working with big data operations and programming (Excel & Python preferred).
Critical thinking and the ability to work independently, taking ownership of tasks and initiatives.




Desirable:

Familiarity with database management tools such as SQL or Azure.
Proven ability to develop tools or models for business analysis.
Knowledge of energy markets and regulatory frameworks.




Additional information:

Berlin as a location would be preferred, but Baar, Switzerland would also be possible




Benefits:

Strategic Impact: Be a key player in shaping the companyâ€™s strategic decisions and driving its growth in dynamic markets.
Attractive (discretionary) bonus schemes to reward exceptional contributions.
Opportunity to work in an international, collaborative, and high-performing team.
Fast decision-making processes with direct feedback and the chance to see the tangible impact of your work.




For Berlin as location furthermore:

Attractive pension schemes
Boosting your overall health in form of fresh fruits
Office centrally located (and easily reachable) at the Potsdamer Platz
A great coffee machine
Subsidy to the Deutschlandticket
