Title: BI Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Join TeamViewer, the leader in remote connectivity software. We harness the potential of cutting-edge technologies such as Augmented Reality and Artificial Intelligence to push the boundaries of innovation and shape the future of digitalization.

Our team of more than 1,500 employees spans different continents, cultures and disciplines. With our inclusive values, we celebrate the unique perspectives and talents each individual brings to the table and foster a dynamic work environment where new ideas thrive.

Become part of our winning team and help us create a world that works better.

Responsibilities

We are seeking a highly skilled Business Intelligence Analyst who delivers out-of-sights by leveraging the latest technologies. As a pivotal member of our team, you will closely collaborate with Product Managers to convert raw data into actionable insights that fuel data-driven decision-making. Your role will encompass the complete spectrum of activities from formulating business hypotheses, establishing success metrics, determining tracking requirements, crafting visually captivating data presentations, and effectively communicating conclusive findings to stakeholders.


Analyze large amounts of data within a data-driven company to support important business decisions and operational processes
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their data analysis needs and translate them into actionable business metrics and KPIs
Develop and maintain BI dashboards using best-practice data modeling techniques
Ensure the accuracy and consistency of data through data cleaning and thorough validation processes
Create and maintain documentation including requirements, design, and user manuals


Requirements


University degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Systems or equivalent experience with a focus on data
Minimum 2 years of professional experience in a similar position, ideally within the software industry
Advanced SQL knowledge, and ideally experience on Tableau or similar BI tools (e.g. Looker, Power BI)
Highly motivated to solve complex problems in close collaboration with other team members, goal-oriented, and eager to make a real difference to the business
Good grasp of business contexts and processes
Great communication skills complement your interactions with internal and external stakeholders and with stakeholders
Fluency in English is mandatory, further languages are a plus


What We Offer


Onsite Onboarding in our HQ office for an optimal start
Great compensation and benefits packages including company achievement bonuses and company stocks, regular salary reviews
Premiums for the private pension plan (BAV) up to the maximum amount are topped up by TeamViewer
Public transport-friendly offices
Option to lease an e-bike or use one of the electric cars
Special terms for local gyms
Access to Corporate Benefits platform with many discounts
Regular Team events and company-wide celebrations
Open door policy, no dress code rules, frequent all Hands and Leadership Lunches
Hybrid and Flexible work time with up to 50% home office
Work From Abroad Program allowing up to 40 days of work outside your contracting country
We celebrate diversity as one of our core values, join and drive one of the c-a-r-e initiatives together with us!


TeamViewer is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to building an inclusive culture where everyone feels welcome and supported. We C-A-R-E and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. As we continue to grow as a company, we also focus on enabling our employees to grow both personally and professionally. We are proud to have an open and embracing workplace environment that will empower you to be your best no matter your gender, civil or family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.
Show more
HTML:
Join TeamViewer, the leader in remote connectivity software. We harness the potential of cutting-edge technologies such as Augmented Reality and Artificial Intelligence to push the boundaries of innovation and shape the future of digitalization.

Our team of more than 1,500 employees spans different continents, cultures and disciplines. With our inclusive values, we celebrate the unique perspectives and talents each individual brings to the table and foster a dynamic work environment where new ideas thrive.

Become part of our winning team and help us create a world that works better.

Responsibilities

We are seeking a highly skilled Business Intelligence Analyst who delivers out-of-sights by leveraging the latest technologies. As a pivotal member of our team, you will closely collaborate with Product Managers to convert raw data into actionable insights that fuel data-driven decision-making. Your role will encompass the complete spectrum of activities from formulating business hypotheses, establishing success metrics, determining tracking requirements, crafting visually captivating data presentations, and effectively communicating conclusive findings to stakeholders.

  • Analyze large amounts of data within a data-driven company to support important business decisions and operational processes
  • Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their data analysis needs and translate them into actionable business metrics and KPIs
  • Develop and maintain BI dashboards using best-practice data modeling techniques
  • Ensure the accuracy and consistency of data through data cleaning and thorough validation processes
  • Create and maintain documentation including requirements, design, and user manuals

Requirements

  • University degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Systems or equivalent experience with a focus on data
  • Minimum 2 years of professional experience in a similar position, ideally within the software industry
  • Advanced SQL knowledge, and ideally experience on Tableau or similar BI tools (e.g. Looker, Power BI)
  • Highly motivated to solve complex problems in close collaboration with other team members, goal-oriented, and eager to make a real difference to the business
  • Good grasp of business contexts and processes
  • Great communication skills complement your interactions with internal and external stakeholders and with stakeholders
  • Fluency in English is mandatory, further languages are a plus

What We Offer

  • Onsite Onboarding in our HQ office for an optimal start
  • Great compensation and benefits packages including company achievement bonuses and company stocks, regular salary reviews
  • Premiums for the private pension plan (BAV) up to the maximum amount are topped up by TeamViewer
  • Public transport-friendly offices
  • Option to lease an e-bike or use one of the electric cars
  • Special terms for local gyms
  • Access to Corporate Benefits platform with many discounts
  • Regular Team events and company-wide celebrations
  • Open door policy, no dress code rules, frequent all Hands and Leadership Lunches
  • Hybrid and Flexible work time with up to 50% home office
  • Work From Abroad Program allowing up to 40 days of work outside your contracting country
  • We celebrate diversity as one of our core values, join and drive one of the c-a-r-e initiatives together with us!

TeamViewer is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to building an inclusive culture where everyone feels welcome and supported. We C-A-R-E and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. As we continue to grow as a company, we also focus on enabling our employees to grow both personally and professionally. We are proud to have an open and embracing workplace environment that will empower you to be your best no matter your gender, civil or family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Title: Digital Data Specialist
Description:
Your Role: As a Digital Data Specialist, youâ€™ll be the architect behind our data-driven success story. Youâ€™ll be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting digital data to uncover actionable insights. From optimizing marketing campaigns to enhancing user experiences, your expertise will be instrumental in shaping our strategies and driving growth.

What Youâ€™ll Do:


Dive deep into digital data sources to extract meaningful insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into data requirements.
Develop and implement data collection strategies across various digital platforms.
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimization.
Create compelling data visualizations and reports to communicate findings effectively.
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to continuously innovate our data practices.


What Weâ€™re Looking For:


Passion for data-driven decision-making and problem-solving.
Strong analytical skills with a keen eye for detail.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Domo.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex ideas to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven track record of driving business impact through data insights.
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field (or equivalent experience).


Why Join Us:


Opportunity to work with a dynamic team of industry experts and thought leaders.
Flexible remote work environment, empowering you to balance work and life.
Ongoing learning and development opportunities to fuel your professional growth.
Competitive compensation package and benefits.

Title: Full-Stack Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Upvest, founded in 2017, enables any financial institution to offer great investment experiences to its customers. Upvest is an investment firm regulated by the German supervision authority (BaFin). The company currently employs 160+ people across Europe with its headquarters based in Berlin, Germany.

The company is backed by the worldâ€™s largest venture capital funds and investors including Bessemer Venture Partners, BlackRock, Earlybird, HV Capital, Notion Capital, and ABN Amro Ventures, as well as by renowned fintech entrepreneurs (including Maximilian Tayenthal, founder of N26, and Felix Haas, founder of IDnow).

Weâ€™re looking for fintech enthusiasts to join us in creating the financial infrastructure of tomorrow. Weâ€™re building the first European Investment API to enable any financial institution offering a wide range of efficient and transparent investment products, such as stocks and ETFs in nominal, portfolio, and fractional form. Our mission and vision is to make investing as easy as spending money.

Weâ€™re based in Berlin but are also open to hiring remotely in Germany or Estonia for this role. If you're currently based elsewhere but would like to move to Germany, weâ€™re happy to support your relocation.

Team's mission

At Upvest, you'll become an integral part of our Data Management community where Analysts, and Engineers collaborate to learn and grow together. Moreover, our integrated organisational structure provides you with the opportunity to work closely across finance, product, engineering, finance, and operations areas.

What will you work on?

Data Analysis and Insights: Dive into complex datasets to extract valuable insights and trends that drive data-informed decisions, ensuring our B2B offerings are optimised for success.

Client Data Analysis & Customised Reporting: You'll conduct in-depth analysis of client data to provide actionable insights and create custom reports and data visualisations tailored to our B2B clients' specific needs, enabling them to make informed decisions and gain a competitive edge.

Data Architecture and Tools: Collaborate on data architecture projects with a primary focus on achieving 100% data consistency. Utilise advanced tools such as DBT, BigQuery, and Looker, prioritising data quality and integrity in all data modelling and analysis tasks. This approach enhances our ability to meet client needs by ensuring consistent and reliable data.

Cross-Functional Impact: Collaborate with various teams, including developers and product managers, to seamlessly integrate your data-driven insights into our B2B products and services, driving continuous improvement.

Data Strategy Implementation and Product Enhancement: Play a pivotal role in executing our data strategy, ensuring that data-driven solutions are seamlessly integrated into our B2B offerings, and work to enhance our financial APIs and services based on data-driven insights that meet our clients' evolving needs. Additionally, actively support the initiative to transform our data into a standalone product, leveraging your analytical skills to develop valuable insights and features that can be marketed and sold to a wider audience, thus expanding our revenue streams and market presence.

This Role Will Give You The Opportunity To

Data-Driven Impact: You will have the opportunity to work on projects that directly influence the success of our financial API offerings. Your data analyses and insights will shape decision-making, improve client experiences, and contribute to the growth of our business.

Variety of Data Challenges: You'll confront a broad spectrum of data-related tasks, focusing on careful data modelling rather than mere extraction. Advanced analytics and visualisation will be integral parts of your role. Each project will offer fresh and engaging opportunities to refine your analytical expertise.

Collaboration: Expect a collaborative environment where you'll work closely with talented professionals across different teams, including developers, product managers, and financial experts. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do.

Continuous Learning: You'll enjoy ongoing opportunities for professional development. We provide comprehensive training programs, workshops, and resources to enhance your data analysis skills and keep you at the forefront of industry trends.

An experienced team and culture driven organisation: Despite the early stage of the company, we have assembled a world-class team with lots of experience across all key domains that we require for our success, from banking and risk to regulatory, legal and compliance to product and engineering. The organisation is also full of people who have successfully scaled companies before, who understand the importance of live and breath culture and â€œpeople firstâ€.

Job Requirements


3-5 years of experience in an analyst or data engineering role requiring data interrogation, analysis, and storytelling skills, paired with proficient stakeholder management
Proficiency in handling complex datasets and preparing them at the right granularity in a robust way
Conducting analysis to preemptively identify issues and surface actionable insights and recommendations to mitigate risk
Expertise in data visualisation and using data insights to deliver actionable recommendations that drive business goals
Expert level proficiency in SQL, experience working with DBT (Data Build Tool), BigQuery, and Looker, or equivalent, is essential
Proficiency in another programming language ( Python, R, Java etc)
Comfortable with the Git workflow and proficiency with a general-purpose programming language, as well as exposure to meta-programming is a plus
A builder's mindset with a willingness to question assumptions and challenge conventional wisdom
Ability to communicate results clearly and concisely with a focus on driving measurable impact
Demonstrated ability to independently manage project work and effectively prioritise projects to meet deadlines
Proven experience working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to deliver results


Why Upvest?


Greenfield projects. Weâ€™re building something quite complex and a first in Europe. This means weâ€™re working with cutting-edge technologies and with no legacy code.
Wellbeing. At Upvest, everyone has access to our in-house coach where you can have regular sessions to support you personally and professionally.
Development. In keeping with one of our core values, â€˜Learn and Growâ€™, every Upvenger has access to a development budget. In line with one of our other values, â€˜Own the Outcomeâ€™, how you choose to make the most of it, is up to you.
Flexibility. We work in a hybrid setup with the team distributed around Germany and Europe. We give you the choice (and budget) to spend your time where you are most comfortable and productive, either at home or the office. You choose.


Our Values


Learn and grow. We aim high to shape our future. We give and request honest feedback knowing that we develop together. Progression over Perfection.
Team first. We make it easy for others. We value our differences and are open to others' opinions. We win and celebrate together! Team over Egos.
Own the outcome. Whether we win or we lose, we stand together. We are proactive and get the job done. Outcome over Process.
Tell the story. We always start with the why. We share knowledge to empower others. Transparency over Complexity.


Upvest is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees
Show more

Title: Manufacturing Data Analyst @ Deltia (Remote within Europe)
Description:
Your role

In This Role You Will


Leverage artificial intelligence to drive operational excellence in our customers
Work closely with our consulting and technical teams to actively identify solutions to increase efficiency, improve ergonomics, and reduce costs within our customersâ€™ manufacturing processes
Combine traditional Lean Management and Six Sigma methods with artificial intelligence to drive process optimization
Analyze processes and business data to support strategic decisions and calculate their monetary impact
Monitor and report the progress of process improvement initiatives including their actual monetary business impact
Create and maintain process documentation and standards using Deltiaâ€™s AI software


Your profile

Requirements


Enrolled or recently graduate from a Masterâ€™s program in Business Administration, Information Systems, Engineering or a related field
1+ years of experience in a startup or consultancy environment
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact effectively with team members and clients
Experience in analyzing and optimizing business processes
Dedication and drive in solving customer problems
Strong analytical skills and experience using data analysis tools (e.g., Power BI) and with SQL
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel for data analysis
Fluent written and spoken English skills; German is a plus


Nice-to-have


Knowledge of project management and process improvement methods such as Lean Management and Six Sigma
Experience in the manufacturing industry is an advantage, but not essential
Experience with Python or R is a plus


What we offer


Paid internship position
Be on the forefront in defining what artificial intelligence means in manufacturing
Gain hands-on experience in working in an AI-first software company
The option to work in a brand new office situated on the AI Campus in Berlin where we closely cooperate with other exciting AI ventures
Work remotely from anywhere in Europe
Supportive and inclusive culture that values diversity and promotes the advancement of underrepresented groups within the company
Collaborate with a diverse (currently more than 10 nationalities) and talented team, working on cutting-edge projects with real-world impact
Network with professionals and leaders in the field, opening doors to potential future career opportunities
Ethicsâš–ï¸: We are committed to developing ethical AI software


Apply for this job

About Us

We're a dynamic AI startup reshaping manufacturing with advanced tech like computer vision and AI. Our mission? Empower workers to boost productivity using cutting-edge tools. Starting with assembly processes, we'll expand to logistics and more.

Led by Max, who digitized 40 factories, and Silviu, a computer vision expert, our team includes top talent from ETH, MIT, and industry leaders. We value hard work, creativity, and diversity. Backed by Merantix and Cavalry, we offer comprehensive benefits, flexible schedules, and a supportive work environment.

Join us on the Berlin AI Campus, part of a vibrant ecosystem of engineers and entrepreneurs from top universities worldwide.

Title: Staff Data Analyst, DATA (m/f/d)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure and data models enables you to identify needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What Youâ€™ll Do


Accountable for your teamsâ€™ data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the â€œso-whatsâ€ of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!

Show more
HTML:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure and data models enables you to identify needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What Youâ€™ll Do

  • Accountable for your teamsâ€™ data catalogue and delivery documentation
  • Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
  • Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
  • Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the â€œso-whatsâ€ of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
  • Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
  • Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
  • Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams

What You'll Bring

  • Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
  • Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
  • Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
  • Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
  • Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
  • Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
  • A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
  • You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.

What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.

  • Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
  • Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
  • Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
  • Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
  • Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!

Title: BI Business Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Lloyds Bank GmbH and its brands Bank of Scotland and Lloyds Bank have won over 1 million satisfied customers in recent years. And this thanks to convincing products and, above all, our committed colleagues who want to achieve the best for our customers every day with new ideas, challenges and joy. In order to continue writing our success story, we are looking for the right reinforcement for our teams, because all our ambitious goals would be unattainable without teamwork. We also welcome career changers.

For our office in Berlin Mitte we are looking for a

BI Business Analyst (m/f/d)

Aufgaben


Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify reporting and analysis needs and appropriate business intelligence solutions from a central data warehouse
Translate reporting needs into functional and technical requirements and manage them throughout their lifecycle
Carry out impact assessments of source system changes or regulatory reporting landscape with effects on the data warehouse
Identify root causes for code defects and assign it to the developers and other groups (e.g. data providers) ensuring that counteracting measures are taken and defects are solved in a timely manner
Supporting the Product Owner with the definition of work packages of BI projects and clarification of details requirements with input from stakeholders and technical architects
Work closely with BI developers in different locations
Take responsibility and ensure delivery of the proposed solutions
Hands on development of BI solutions including reporting functionalities via powerBI
Actively drive transformation through BI solutions being able to challenge the status quo and think outside the box
Ensure adherence to development standards and processes within Lloyds Bank NL and Lloyds Banking Group


Profil


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business studies and/or IT
Proven work experience as a BA or in a BI/ Reporting/ IT environment
Proven work experience with analytics and data analysis
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to prioritise
Functional understanding of data warehousing and ETL processes
Ability to develop strong working relationships and work collaboratively across organizational levels
Ability to answer complex questions in a structured and clear way and communicate to non-technical stakeholders
Proficient in SQL being able to write structured and efficient queries on big data sets
Knowledge in data visualization with PowerBI (or any other visualization tool)
Experience working in a scrum environment is a plus
Strong oral and written communication skills in English


Wir bieten


An international team with colleagues from more than 50 different countries
Social benefits such as a company pension scheme and capital formation contributions
30 days holiday as well as 24 and 31 December as non-working days
Employee Assistance Programme â€“ personal 24/7 helpline for all employees
Various possibilities for flexible working, i.a. various part-time models, flexitime
Extensive, very flexible home office arrangements
Possibility to work from other EU countries for up to 30 days per year
Additional benefits such as sports activities, free fruit, nuts and drinks
Employer contributions to BVG job ticket and a Lease a bike programme
An informal corporate culture - without dress code and â€˜Sie'.
An excellent learning culture and opportunity to improve your professional competencies
Easily accessible city centre offices, in the vicinity of many shops and restaurants to which you receive a discount


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Title: Data Analyst, Merge Mansion
Description:
We are a mobile game company, based in both Helsinki and Berlin, creating world-class entertainment by building a portfolio of hit games. Since our launch in 2020, our first chart-topping game Merge Mansion has been entertaining over 55 million players worldwide, and we have grown into a team of over 200.

Our mission is to entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, with our games, and also through our creative marketing, community, and beyond â€“ while having fun with it.

Weâ€™re ordinary people crafting extraordinary games with passion and ambition, united by our culture of trust, psychological safety and wellbeing.

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to make the much-loved hit game Merge Mansion even better by conducting in-depth data analyses and presenting findings to a wide range of different stakeholders. Youâ€™ll join a multidisciplinary feature team for Merge Mansion and work closely with game development teams to provide valuable data insights and analyses that support their efforts.

More about Metacore crafts: https://metacoregames.com/our-crafts

Responsibilities


Supporting product managers and designers by finding insights through quantitative and qualitative analysis, as well as ideating and monitoring the impact of our product decisions
Proactively analyzing our game data to spot opportunities for improvements and growth that will guide our game design and monetization strategies
Designing and evaluating experiments
Driving decision-making through in-depth statistical modeling and analyses, and well-crafted presentations for both technical and non-technical team members
Building and maintaining dashboards, version-controlled tools and reports
Designing analytics tracking events that help us better understand our players and features
Designing data pipelines in cooperation with our data engineering team
Spreading best practices to elevate our data teamâ€™s success



Requirements


Prior work experience as an analyst in the F2P gaming industry
Proficiency in SQL and coding skills in a scripting language like Python or R
Hands-on experience in data modeling and cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake, BigQuery, or Redshift
Practical know-how of some BI tools such as Looker, Qlick, Tableau, or similar
Solid knowledge of industry-standard statistical analyses like A/B testing
Proactive mindset with a focus on identifying and working on high-impact tasks
A curious personality complemented by strong teamwork skills



In addition to these, it would be nice but not mandatory for you to have these as well:


Extensive experience in applying data science methods from concept to production
Practical knowledge in metrics/semantic-layer and/or dbt
A degree in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or Engineering



What We Offer


Workplace where we aim high, without taking ourselves too seriously
Autonomy and accountability with support to foster professional development
Great opportunities to grow with the company
Work-life balance and strong emphasis on wellbeing
Approachable leaders with low ego
Flexible hybrid workplace where people enjoy working at the office



Basics


Location: Helsinki, Finland or Berlin, Germany
Relocation: Relocating to Finland or Germany expected, full support provided
Work model: Mix of office and remote work
Working language: English



Our equal opportunity statement

To entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, we need diverse teams that understand our diverse audiences. The key to unleash our creativity is a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture of trust where Metacoreans from all walks of life can be themselves. We celebrate our differences and believe they are the strength that drives us forward.

We are committed to offering equal opportunities for all, regardless of background, age, race, color, ethnicity, religion, disability, gender, sexual orientation, family status, education, socioeconomic status or any other characteristic. We build and maintain a workplace and industry free of harassment and discrimination.

We also aspire to have DE&I as a fundamental part of our game design process to enable us to create even better and more inclusive games, communities and entertainment.

If you require any support or have specific needs during the application process, please don't hesitate to let us know. We look forward to hearing from you!

Our culture

Our culture is based on trust, psychological safety and wellbeing. At Metacore, autonomy and accountability go firmly hand in hand, and we cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace where you can be yourself.

We are collaborative and humble, and think â€œweâ€ before â€œmeâ€. We enable focus through transparency and ownership. We aim high, and aspire to be nothing less than the best game company in the world to work for.

To create even better games, communities and entertainment, we welcome talent with diverse experiences, who are passionate about their roles and bold in their ambition.

We have collectively defined our culture and values, and we uphold them together, every day.

Read more about our culture: https://metacoregames.com/culture

  • Du hast mindestens ein Jahr Erfahrung mit dbt und ein tiefgehendes VerstÃ¤ndnis von ETL-Pipelines. Auch Tableau oder Ã¤hnliche Dashboarding Tools sind Dir nicht fremd.
  • Deine ausgeprÃ¤gten KommunikationsfÃ¤higkeiten ermÃ¶glichen eine effektive Zusammenarbeit mit internen und externen Stakeholdern.
  • Du legst nicht nur hohe QualitÃ¤tsansprÃ¼che an Deine Arbeit, sondern bringst auch eine Can-Do-MentalitÃ¤t mit, die Dich selbst und andere motiviert.
  • Du hast mindestens B2-Kenntnisse in Deutsch und sprichst flÃ¼ssiges Englisch.


Auch wenn Du nicht alle oben genannten Anforderungen erfÃ¼llst, ermutigen wir Dich dennoch, Dich zu bewerben. Wir sind der Meinung, dass vielfÃ¤ltige Perspektiven und Erfahrungen unser Team bereichern und fÃ¶rdern eine Kultur des kontinuierlichen Lernens und Wachstums. Deine einzigartige Erfahrung und FÃ¤higkeiten kÃ¶nnten genau das sein, was wir brauchen!

ZusÃ¤tzliche Informationen

  • Arbeite in Deutschlands erstem grÃ¼nen Unicorn und gestalte aktiv die solare Energiewende mit.
  • Die Sonne scheint auf der ganzen Welt - Bei Enpal findest du ein hochmotiviertes und diverses Team, mit mehr als 65 verschiedenen NationalitÃ¤ten.
  • Lieber dem Haustier daheim oder den Kolleg*innen im BÃ¼ro Gesellschaft leisten? Auch nach der Pandemie bieten wir dir ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell.
  • Wir erfÃ¼llen jedes Startup-Klischee - In unserem modernen Office in Berlin-Friedrichshain findest du von Tischtennisplatte und Yoga-Ecke bis Dachterrasse und gefÃ¼llten GetrÃ¤nkekÃ¼hlschrÃ¤nken alles was das Herz begehrt.
  • Dein Kick-start bei Enpal - Lerne an deinem Onboarding-Tag das Unternehmen, deine Teamkolleg*innen und unseren GrÃ¼nder Mario kennen.
  • Bleib auf dem Laufenden - Egal ob Unternehmenszahlen bei unseren monatlichen All-Hands-Meetings oder die Funktionsweise einer Photovoltaikanlage beim Lunch & Learn, du weiÃŸt immer genau Bescheid.
  • Energiewende geht nur gemeinsam â€“ Bei Enpal erwartet dich ein legendÃ¤rer Teamspirit und unvergessliche Teamevents.
  • Ohne Fehler kein Fortschritt â€“ Wir leben eine starke Feedback-Kultur und wachsen mit deinem Input.


Wir bei Enpal sind stolz auf die VielfÃ¤ltigkeit unseres Teams. Weder bei der Einstellung noch wÃ¤hrend des BeschÃ¤ftigungsverhÃ¤ltnisses werden Entscheidungen auf Basis von Hautfarbe, Religion oder religiÃ¶sen Glaubens, ethnischer oder nationaler Herkunft, NationalitÃ¤t, GeschlechteridentitÃ¤t, sexuelle Orientierung, Behinderung oder Alter getroffen. Enpal steht fÃ¼r einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz und geht gegen Diskriminierung und BelÃ¤stigung jeglicher Art vor.

Title: Data Analyst & AI Product Builder
Description:
This role requires presence in our Berlin office. Native German skills are a plus but not a must.

ðŸŒŽ What we do

We build software that helps companies along the food system get to Net Zero.

~31% of global GHG emissions originate from food-related activities. For the first time in history, climate performance has become an overall business performance indicator. Enterprises are mandated by regulatory bodies to disclose their climate performance, which leads to increasing pressure from investors, competitors, retailers, and consumers to prevent and reduce their CO2e emissions. Over the next 10 years, companies have set ambitious reduction targets that need to be met. Enterprise software and new business processes can help.

We raised >â‚¬10m in funding in the first 2 years of our existence, we launched our enterprise product, signed and onboarded some of the largest F&B players in Europe, and put together what we believe is the best-suited early stage tech team in Europe. Will you be the next to join us? ðŸš€

ðŸ”­ What you will work on

Your mission

Help our users make sense of their data and pave the way to Net Zero Emissions.

Over the next 12 months you will:


Create Actionable Insights for Net Zero
Identify data patterns to help users understand and communicate their carbon footprints more effectively to customers and suppliers.
Turn emission data into clear, impactful insights for users so they can make better decisions.
Bridge data to real-world measures - our users and farmers donâ€™t live in spreadsheets.
Build Prototypes and Products
Develop models and prototypes to help clients set targets and model Net Zero scenarios.
Develop a strong understanding of our users and their unique challenges.
Work closely with the product team to transform prototypes into scalable SaaS products.
Upskill the Team with Data & AI
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in data analytics and AI product building.
Empower self-service across teams.
Foster a data-first culture in a fast-growing environment where itâ€™s easy to simply listen to your gut feeling.

ðŸš€ You might be really good for this role if


You have a "get-it-done" attitude and the ability to learn really fast.
You have a passion for putting together quick, hacky prototypes that you can put in front of users.
You understand and care equally as much about the â€œwhyâ€ behind the numbers, you think outcome-first.
You constantly try out the latest AI tools and have experience building with no-code or low-code platforms like Airtable or Retool.
You were part of the first 20-30 employees at an early stage technology company.
You are highly reliable and can organise your work really well.


You don't feel like you fulfil all the criteria? We get it: confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But guess what?! There is no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. The only thing you need to ensure along the recruiting process and beyond is that the problem that we are solving with Root is one you cannot wait to get out of bed for on Monday morning! ðŸ¤—

ðŸ¦¾ How we support you


You will report directly to our co-founder: Eric
You will get mentored and coached by one of our angel investors and one of the best AI product builders in Europe: Tevfik


ðŸŽ¢ Hiring Process

Our ambition is to offer you an end-to-end experience that is fast and uncomplicated - we aim to keep the end-to-end process to 10 working days. We send you prep material for each step and maximise transparency at every step.

Title: Data Science Graduate
Description:
Company Description

Fascinated by the future and captivated by technology?

Smart, driven and want to make a difference in the world?

Youâ€™ll fit right in.

Join a diverse team at Visa, where your individuality fits right in. We can provide the opportunity to shape the payments experience globally. Together, letâ€™s transform the way the world pays.

Think you know us?

Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, reliable and secure digital payment network that enables individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.

Individuality fuels our brand and our global team â€” weâ€™re proud to be a talented team of 15,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives and experiences. We understand that you are much more than your day job. We encourage quality of life outside of the office: whether itâ€™s taking advantage of agile working schedules or our wellness programmes, Visa respects and encourages meaningful work/life balance for everyone. In addition, we offer market-leading compensation and have a fantastic benefits offering.

So, if youâ€™re not satisfied with the status quo, we can satisfy your desire to explore new territory, giving you the runway to really make an impact, whilst connecting you with teams around the world in a truly inclusive culture that celebrates our uniqueness.

Job Description

What we expect of you, day to day:

The Data Scientist graduate is a key member of the client facing Data Science Lab team in the European region. As a Data Scientist, you will be accountable for the development and delivery of analytics driven strategies and solutions for Visaâ€™s external clients in Europe. In this role, you will work collaboratively with VCA and a multitude of internal functions, their senior leaders and our clients in promoting insights driven culture, creative and cutting edge analytic solutions and best practices to drive business performance with a clear commercial â€˜valueâ€™ and measurable â€˜returnâ€™. Half of your day will involve delivering project (coding/working with data) and the other half will be dedicated to discussing data requirements, managing internal and external meetings. Please bear in mind that our workload varies tremendously given each project is very bespoke, sometimes we might be delivering a csv file, another time a predictive machine learning model or segmentation. Whatever the solution is, you will be involved in the end to end process starting from gathering clients requirements all the way to delivering actionable insight enabling our clients to make data driven business decisions.

Principal Responsibilities


Evangelizes the creative use of data science to solve business problems with external clientsâ€¯
Works with VCA consultants in market to drive data science business development opportunities across key accounts to meet VCA revenue targets
Applies data science and predictive techniques that can be used to enhance client profitability across acquisition and retention
Works with VCA consultants on conducting VisaNet data analysis on key metrics in order to articulate key issuer P&L opportunities to drive revenue growth for our clients and Visa
Create and deliver powerful business-centric insights from data through better visualization and storyboarding
Collaborating with the internal and external partners to fully understand business requirements and desired business outcomes
Execution proficiency in handling multiple medium to large data science projects along with rest of the stakeholders in the project team
Defining detailed analytic scope and methodology, and creating analytic plans
Executing on the analytic plans with appropriate data mining and statistical techniques
Ensuring project delivery within timelines and budget requirements
Ensuring all project documentation is up to date and all projects are reviewed per analytic plan
Enhancing existing solutions and approaches by promoting new methodology and best practices in data science field
Providing subject matter expertise and quality assurance of complex data science projects
Automating processes/codes
Familiarising yourself with new tools/software/techniques


Qualifications

What weâ€™re afterâ€¦


Graduate/Post Graduate degree (Masters or Ph.D.) in Quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Operational Research, Computer Science, Economics, or engineering or equivalent experience .
Graduating in 2025.
Results oriented with strong analytical, consultative and problem-solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor
Familiarity with modern distributed systems, including both Hadoop/SQL/MLP and Apache Spark etc.
Familiarity with one or more data analytics/programming tools such as Python
Knowledge of applying predictive modelling and machine learning technique to problems
Ability to communicate with impact and interest in working in a consulting-like environment and client-facing project roles


Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

In this role, you will work collaboratively with VCA and a multitude of internal functions, their senior leaders and our clients in promoting insights driven culture, creative and cutting edge analytic solutions and best practices to drive business performance with a clear commercial â€˜valueâ€™ and measurable â€˜returnâ€™. Half of your day will involve delivering project (coding/working with data) and the other half will be dedicated to discussing data requirements, managing internal and external meetings. Please bear in mind that our workload varies tremendously given each project is very bespoke, sometimes we might be delivering a csv file, another time a predictive machine learning model or segmentation. Whatever the solution is, you will be involved in the end to end process starting from gathering clients requirements all the way to delivering actionable insight enabling our clients to make data driven business decisions.

Principal Responsibilities

  • Evangelizes the creative use of data science to solve business problems with external clientsâ€¯
  • Works with VCA consultants in market to drive data science business development opportunities across key accounts to meet VCA revenue targets
  • Applies data science and predictive techniques that can be used to enhance client profitability across acquisition and retention
  • Works with VCA consultants on conducting VisaNet data analysis on key metrics in order to articulate key issuer P&L opportunities to drive revenue growth for our clients and Visa
  • Create and deliver powerful business-centric insights from data through better visualization and storyboarding
  • Collaborating with the internal and external partners to fully understand business requirements and desired business outcomes
  • Execution proficiency in handling multiple medium to large data science projects along with rest of the stakeholders in the project team
  • Defining detailed analytic scope and methodology, and creating analytic plans
  • Executing on the analytic plans with appropriate data mining and statistical techniques
  • Ensuring project delivery within timelines and budget requirements
  • Ensuring all project documentation is up to date and all projects are reviewed per analytic plan
  • Enhancing existing solutions and approaches by promoting new methodology and best practices in data science field
  • Providing subject matter expertise and quality assurance of complex data science projects
  • Automating processes/codes
  • Familiarising yourself with new tools/software/techniques

Qualifications

What weâ€™re afterâ€¦

  • Graduate/Post Graduate degree (Masters or Ph.D.) in Quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Operational Research, Computer Science, Economics, or engineering or equivalent experience .
  • Graduating in 2025.
  • Results oriented with strong analytical, consultative and problem-solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor
  • Familiarity with modern distributed systems, including both Hadoop/SQL/MLP and Apache Spark etc.
  • Familiarity with one or more data analytics/programming tools such as Python
  • Knowledge of applying predictive modelling and machine learning technique to problems
  • Ability to communicate with impact and interest in working in a consulting-like environment and client-facing project roles

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
We are Kolibri Games - a mobile games developer from Berlin. We believe that with the best people, we can make games that players will enjoy for years to come.

Our games have defined the idle genre, and bring enjoyment to hundreds of millions of players all around the world. This is possible due to the talented people who make us who we are. 'Kolibris', as we call ourselves, are on a mission to continue making great games and we're looking for new talent to join our team. We strive to offer you a fair recruitment process and a great candidate experience, as well as a friendly environment to work in, with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow.

Aufgaben

As a Lead Game Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our games' success by leveraging data insights to drive strategic decisions across game design, player behavior analysis, and monetization strategies. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our games remain competitive and captivating in the dynamic gaming industry landscape.

We have ambitious plans around growth and the data team is integral to our success, directly impacting our key decisions.

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will lead a team of data analysts and spearhead our data efforts in Product, User Acquisition and monetization, leveraging data to drive decisions and strategies that significantly boost our performance and revenue.


Lead and mentor a team of data analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
Utilize exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to interpret complex game telemetry data and identify actionable insights.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and executive leadership, presenting data-driven recommendations to drive informed decision-making.
Champion a data-driven culture within the organization, promoting data literacy and empowering team members to leverage key performance indicators (KPIs) for strategic initiatives.
Work with the Data Engineering team to help direct their efforts and be the key communicator between the main stakeholders in the company requiring data
Drive experimentation and A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the impact of game changes on player behavior, monetization, and engagement.
Analyze player retention and churn rates, identifying opportunities to enhance player experiences and maximize long-term value.
Collaborate with Product Leads and Head of Growth to influence product development and strategies by gaining insights through analysis of patterns, relationships and trends across complex data sets, directly impacting the company and game revenue.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices, leveraging advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies to maintain a competitive edge, as well as, digital marketing environment and marketing measuring frameworks.
Build and monitor predictive models that will help daily Product, User Acquisition and Monetization decisions.


Profil


5+ years of experience in data analysis in the gaming industry.
Proven experience managing a team, having exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities
Experience with real-time data analysis for live operations in games.
Ability to write complex queries using languages such as SQL
Experience using Python, BI tools such as Looker or similar
Previous experience with AB testing
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies as well as key gaming industry KPIs and metrics
Games industry experience with a strong understanding of the game and player market
Strong problem-solving skills and creativity in addressing complex challenges.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.


Desirable skills


Proficiency in additional programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, etc.).
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies or game industry pattern
Experience with Product Data Science, including but not limited to Churn Prediction, LTV.
An applied understanding of Player Psychology and/or Economics.


Wir bieten

Full-Time | Berlin, Germany

Hybrid Work

We understand how important flexibility is. That's why we offer a hybrid work setup and flexible hours, allowing you to balance your time between the office and remote work

Modern Office Space

Our new, centrally located office in Berlin-Mitte has everything you need to excel. We also have plenty of opportunities for fun, with table tennis and kicker tables, meeting spaces, and a sleek modern design

Health & Fitness Bonus

We provide a monthly fitness bonus. Enjoy your time outside the office by picking the activity that suits you, from Urban Sports Club, to covering your gym membership

Company Holidays

We plan amazing company holidays to relax and bond as a team

Learning Budget

We're serious about supporting your professional growth. You'll get a yearly learning budget to spend on any form of learning that will help you develop your skills and grow in your role

Relocation

Moving to another country can be stressful. Our HR team will guide and support you, making sure that you (and your family) make your way to Berlin as smoothly as possible

30 Days Holiday

Our company implements a 30-day yearly holiday policy for all Kolibris. This means you have plenty of time to enjoy life outside of work

Fun Social Events

From BBQ's and movie nights to team lunches and more. We also have a team event budget you can use to buy games or sports equipment to make working here even more fun. On Fridays after work, there's dinner and drinks waiting for everyone at the office

Kolibri Games is an equal opportunity employer. We come from 40 different countries and many different backgrounds. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of their age, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, physical appearance or disability.

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Title: Operations Performance Analyst (m,f,x)
Description:
Job Description

Role Background

Join our dynamic Operations Analytics Team! As a cornerstone of our organization, this team serves as a one-stop shop for all data analytics needs related to operations and venues. We pride ourselves on our ability to analyze, automate, and guide other teams, functioning as a consultancy/support mechanism. Our work involves close interactions with upper management, contributing significantly to critical strategic discussions. To excel in this role, you must possess a blend of analytical prowess and exceptional communication skills.

What You'll Be Doing


Conducting in-depth analyses using Looker and Excel to support various operational and venue-related teams.
Automating processes to enhance efficiency across departments.
Providing consultancy and support to operational and venue teams to steer their activities based on data-driven insights.
Engaging in regular exchanges with upper management and contributing to strategic decision-making processes.
Preparing reports for upper management, occasionally presenting findings through PowerPoint presentations.


Our humble expectations

Important to have:


Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Fluent English skills, both written and verbal
Strong analytical skills coupled with the ability to communicate findings effectively.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills.
A proactive attitude towards problem-solving and continuous improvement.


Plus to have:


Proficiency in SQL and Python
Flexibility in terms of working hours when necessary.


Next Steps

What we offer


A centrally located office in Berlin, next to S-Bahn
Independent work in a high-trust, dynamic, and diverse team
A fast-growing tech company with endless learning opportunities and career growth potential
Competitive salary and benefits, including a discount on Wolt orders
Modern work equipment and office perks (snacks, fruits, coffee, etc.)
Flexible working hours, 30 days of paid vacation, and work-from-home days
Deutschland ticket subsidy and Urban Sports Club membership discount
Quarterly team events and regular opportunities to visit our Berlin head office


Join us and contribute to driving the success of our operations through insightful analytics and strategic support. If you have the right mix of analytical expertise and communication skills, we would love to hear from you!

About Wolt

Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions â€“ as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Yuhoâ€™s Supermarkt brand. Woltâ€™s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Woltâ€™s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.

So, why work at Wolt?

At Wolt, Weâ€™re About Getting Things Done.

Youâ€™ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

We work hard to make cities into better places, and itâ€™s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If youâ€™re passionate about building things that justâ€¦ work, Wolt might be for you.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data based at our HQ in Berlin - SchÃ¶neberg, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:


Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.



Project Leadership:


Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.



Dashboard Creation:


Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.



Report Generation:


Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.



Stakeholder Management:


Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.



Enablement:


Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making



Your profile


4+ yearsâ€™ experience as a data analyst
Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
Experience working with Python.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
Fluency in English (C1)



Nice to have:


Being able to communicate in German



Why COS?


First things first: Youâ€™ll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europeâ€™s automotive market together with you
Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us

Title: Operations Data Analyst (d/f/m)
Description:
Our Story

Every year millions of people are either filing their taxes in fear or giving up on their tax refund altogether. We're working on fixing that. Our intuitive app enables anyone, regardless of education or background, to file their taxes with newfound confidence.

Spread across Germany, Spain, and the UK, the team at Taxfix Group with its brands Taxfix, Steuerbot, and TaxScouts, is a compassionate group of solution-finders. We speak our minds openly, and with over 400 professionals, including tax experts, developers, and IT security experts, we're rich in ideas and voices. The group has facilitated more than 3.5 billion euros in tax refunds for its customers since its founding in 2016.

Your Challenge

As our Operations Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in empowering our operations team with data-driven insights and scalable solutions. You'll lead the charge in building robust data models, crafting intuitive dashboards, and designing precise forecasting models that elevate operational efficiency and customer satisfaction. Collaborating across teams, you will ensure data accessibility and clarity, enabling informed decision-making at every level of the Taxfix Group.

Your Responsibilities


Structure and model operational data from diverse sources using tools like dbt and Snowflake, creating a scalable foundation for future growth.
Develop and maintain intuitive dashboards in Looker, empowering teams to access and monitor key performance indicators.
Design and refine forecasting models to analyze historical trends and predict future operations across multiple channels, aiding resource and headcount planning.
Analyze workload and operational data to identify optimization opportunities and provide actionable recommendations for improved team efficiency.
Explore customer behavior patterns to enhance satisfaction and effectively manage customer load.
Collaborate with the operations team to collect and prioritize data requirements, ensuring their critical needs are met promptly.
Act as the bridge between operations and technical teams, translating business needs into actionable insights and use cases for AI and LLM integration.


Your Profile


Minimum 2 years of experience in data analytics roles such as Data Analyst, BI Analyst, or Analytics Engineer.
Proficiency in SQL, with foundational experience in dbt for data modeling.
Familiarity with cloud data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery), BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, PowerBI), and advanced spreadsheet functions.
Basic statistical understanding, especially related to forecasting
Analytical thinker with a strong business mindset and a results-driven approach.
Exceptional communication skills to simplify and convey complex concepts effectively.
Fluent in both German and English.
Experience with operations tools such as Zendesk or Intercom is a plus.


Why Taxfix?


A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals.
Holistic well-being with free mental health coaching sessions and yoga.
A monthly allowance to spend on an extensive range of services that you can use and roll over as flexibly as you like.
Employee stock options for all employeesâ€”because everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create.
30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours.
A generous learning budget to support your personal and professional development and guidance from our internal L&D experts.
Work from abroad for up to six weeks every year. Just align with your team, and then enjoy your trip.
Plenty of opportunities to socialize as a team. In addition to internal tech meetups, our international team hosts regular get-togethersâ€”virtually and in person when possible.
Free tax declaration filing, of course, through the Taxfix appâ€”and internal support for all personal tax-related questions.
Have a four-legged friend in your life? Weâ€™re happy to have dogs join us in the office.


Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture.

At Taxfix, we believe that incredible things happen when you have a wealth of perspectives and experiences. We're proudly committed to equal employment and development opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. To help mitigate any potential unconscious biases, we ask that you refrain from including your picture, age, or marital status on your CV. Let your experiences speak for themselves.

Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyway. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't considered previously.

  • Plenty of opportunities to socialize as a team. In addition to internal tech meetups, our international team hosts regular get-togethersâ€”virtually and in person when possible.
  • Free tax declaration filing, of course, through the Taxfix appâ€”and internal support for all personal tax-related questions.
  • Have a four-legged friend in your life? Weâ€™re happy to have dogs join us in the office.

Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture.

At Taxfix, we believe that incredible things happen when you have a wealth of perspectives and experiences. We're proudly committed to equal employment and development opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. To help mitigate any potential unconscious biases, we ask that you refrain from including your picture, age, or marital status on your CV. Let your experiences speak for themselves.

Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyway. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't considered previously.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
GameDuell is one of the leading casual games companies in Germany, based in the heart of Berlin. With more than 130 million registered players worldwide and more than 800,000 active users every day, across over 40 games in 7 languages, we are constantly looking for ways to improve our products.

To fulfill our mission of bringing people together to have a good time with games, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst *. You will play a crucial role in enhancing our reporting infrastructure and provide valuable data insights that empower different stakeholders across the organization. Your analytical expertise will help us to understand our players even better and to improve their gaming experience.

Tasks

Your Tasks


Conceptualize, continuously enhance, and maintain our reporting infrastructure (using Google BigQuery and MS Power BI)
Optimize existing and establish new data processes to boost efficiency
Develop innovative concepts for dashboard automation to improve reporting efficiency
Implement reporting requests, including data modeling, visualization, and presentation
Generate compelling Power BI reports to turn complex data into clear, actionable insights
Handle ad hoc analysis requests from different teams (such as Marketing and Product)
Design new data requirements for our Data Engineering team, assist with their implementation and partner with other data teams (including BI, Data Science) to develop your solutions
Collaborate with business stakeholders (including Marketing, CRM and Product) to gather requirements, analyze their needs, and translate them into actionable data analysis tasks



Requirements

What we expect


Successfully completed studies in mathematics, business informatics, business administration, or comparable (ideally with a focus on data analytics)
At least 5 years of relevant professional experience in Data Analysis (e.g., as a data analyst, business analyst, product analyst, marketing analyst, etc.)
In-depth knowledge of BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Sound knowledge of SQL for extracting and transforming data from our DWH
Exceptional organizational skills and a very systematic/structured approach
Very good data visualization expertise
Good understanding of data modeling and technical contexts
Fluent knowledge of the English language and excellent communication skills (both with technical and business teams)



Ideally, you should bring along


Experience with mobile attribution and/or CRM tools (e.g., Adjust, Braze, etc.)
Knowledge of statistics
Experience with A/B testing and other test methods
Curiosity and initiative in terms of new trends in the world of data & analytics
Enjoy working in agile and interdisciplinary teams
Affinity for the games industry



Benefits

What we offer


Join a versatile and international team dedicated to ensuring job satisfaction
Experience independent work with demanding tasks and rewarding responsibilites
Benefit from room for professional and personal development
Work-Life Flexibility: Flexible working hours and work models, the choice of your ideal work setup whether it's remote (within Germany) or from our stylish loft office in heart of Berlin, and perks such as fresh fruits, beverages, billiards, table tennis, a rooftop terrace, and much more
Starting: We are excited to welcome you on board as soon as possible



We are an ecological and socially sustainable company and have our very own â€œGreen Teamâ€ where you can make an impact and actively implement ideas and participate in initiatives to help protect our environment and for charity. As a games community, we take our social responsibility seriously. We are co-founders of the â€œLeaders for Climate Actionâ€ and have committed ourselves to being climate responsible.


We pay attention to environmental friendly and resource-efficient standards when purchasing our office and food supplies
We match your charity donations
Social responsibility begins with each of us. Our corporate culture is characterized by mutual trust and respect. Our open and international team welcomes and respects diversity



Contact us

If you are up for the challenge, then say "hello" to our recruiter Stefan!

We look forward to receiving your application. Please send your complete application as PDF with the subject â€˜Senior Data Analyst *â€™ and start the first sentence of your cover letter or e-mail with â€œI would like to work as Data Analyst at GameDuell, becauseâ€¦â€

(*)GameDuell appreciates diverse perspectives and backgrounds, and promotes equal opportunities and an inclusive working environment in which every team member is valued. Any terms referring to people are valid for all genders whether male, female, or diverse.
