Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us




Covering more trades than anyone else, Aspect is one of Londonâ€™s largest property maintenance teams. Weâ€™re always ready to help, no matter what maintenance issue someone has, operating 24/7. After over 15 years of helping thousands of residential and commercial customers every month, we have ambitious plans to expand our business over the next 3 years. Weâ€™re looking for ambitious people to join us at this exciting time.




The Role




The Data Analyst will play a key role in supporting our business through data-driven insights and solutions. Youâ€™ll be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data from multiple sources to help drive decision-making across various departments.

You will:




Use tools like SQL, Python, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, and Salesforce to gather and analyze data.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs), operational efficiency, and customer trends.
Collaborate with teams across the business to identify areas for improvement, optimize processes, and support business growth.
Conduct detailed data analysis, including data mining, trend analysis, and predictive analytics to inform business decisions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all systems, implementing data quality checks and working with different departments to maintain consistent and accurate data inputs.
Provide actionable insights through visualizations and presentations, making complex data understandable for non-technical stakeholders.




This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a strong analytical background and experience in leveraging data tools to support strategic decision-making in a fast-paced environment.




About You




To excel in this role, you should have strong technical skills, a passion for data, and the ability to turn numbers into actionable business insights. Key qualifications include:

Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with Python for data analysis and automation of tasks.
Strong skills in data visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau to create dynamic, interactive reports.
Familiarity with Salesforce CRM or similar platforms to analyze customer and sales data.
Advanced Excel skills for data modeling, forecasting, and reporting.
Excellent problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and a strong understanding of data governance principles.
Strong communication skills with the ability to explain complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Knowledge of the property maintenance or service industry is a plus but not required.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Investment Product Experience Essential | 6-Month Contract | Hybrid | Central London | Circa Â£600-Â£700/day




We are currently partnered with a long-standing Investment client, looking to source for them 2 outstanding Data Analysts. They are looking for strong analysts with experience in SQL, Python, Excel and other tools who also have deep understanding of investment products such as fixed income, derivatives, swaps etc.




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.

Responsibilities

Candidates must be able to profile data, understand complex financial products, and troubleshoot data migration issues
Supporting a large-scale migration project moving investment data to a new platform
Ensuring data integrity, resolving mapping issues and improving logic
Develop clear visualisations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion




Experience

Essential experience in data analysis through SQL, Python, Excel
Essential experience in investment products such as Fixed income and Derivatives
Deep knowledge of Aladdin or Murex
Ability to understand product valuations and cash flow calculations




Logistics

6-Month contract at circa Â£600-Â£700/day
Central London office, 3 days on-site and 2 WFH

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Fully Remote, UK or willing to work UK hours

Contract Type: Full-time, permanent, 40 hour per week Mon-Fri, subject to a 6 month probation

Interviews: Max 3 stages totalling around 3.5 hours

Reports to: Head of Product & Technology

Salary: We have benchmarked a salary in the region of Â£42-Â£50k, dependant upon experience

Why join us? ðŸ‘‹

We are a profitable SaaS business servicing the needs of international law firms and government departments, mostly in the USA and UK. We're on a mission to help our clients become as efficient as possible when it comes to managing huge volumes of information - so that lawyers and business leaders can stay on top of the news that matters, and as a result make faster and better decisions.

The Role:

We are looking for our next Vabler and are seeking a Data Analyst. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in driving insights that fuel user acquisition, retention, and expansion through the product itself. You will leverage data to understand user behaviour, measure success, and optimise our customer journey.

You'll act as a strategic partner, ensuring that all teams are aligned and data-driven insights are used to drive decision-making. We know that you will have meticulous attention to detail, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to work collaboratively across our fully remote team. Your expertise will help shape data-driven strategies to support our continued growth in the competitive SaaS market.

We would love to hear from you if you have the criteria below: ðŸ“¬


A Bachelor's Degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Minimum of 4 years experience in a data analysis or similar role, preferably within a fast-paced SaaS or technology environment. (Scaleup experience is a plus)
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages, such as Python, R or similar for advanced data manipulation and analysis
Have an understanding of the data pipeline, with a familiarity of ETL processes to ensure clean, usable data
Familiarity with statistical analysis techniques e.g., regression, hypothesis testing
Experience working with large datasets and deriving actionable insights
Proficient in Lucene query syntax for querying and analysing data in OpenSearch.
Strong SQL skills for working with AWS Quicksight to create reports and visualisations
Advanced Excel capabilities for quick data manipulation and supplementary analysis
Experience working with Google Analytics for user behaviour tracking and performance metrics
Familiarity with Hotjar for heatmaps and user interaction insights
Ability to define and monitor product KPIs and OKRs, with insights into user funnels and retention metrics
Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively across teams and present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
The right to live and work within the UK or a self employed contractor who can work UK hours, within Europe
Worked within a remote team before and have experience of how it operates



What would your responsibilities look like? ðŸ‘€


Collect, clean, and analyse data from various sources to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with departments, including Sales, Marketing, Product, Engineering, and Client Success, to understand their data needs and provide tailored insights
Provide statistical analysis to validate experiment results and recommend next steps
Ensure data integrity by regularly auditing and maintaining data cleanliness within systems like CRMs and marketing platforms
Partner with the Client Success team to identify and track key metrics driving client satisfaction and retention.
Develop models to predict churn and identify at-risk users.
Provide training and tools for teams to access and utilise data effectively
Build and maintain dashboards for real-time monitoring of these metrics
Interpret data and generate actionable recommendations for us as a team
Analyse client behaviour to understand engagement patterns, activation rates, and drop-off points



This is a great opportunity for you if:

ðŸ¤¸â€â™‚ï¸You are interested in Product Led Growth and want to play a pivotal role in shaping data-driven strategies and providing insights that directly impact the company's growth in a fast-paced environment.

ðŸŒŸ Work in Tech with an established product and have autonomy in your role.

ðŸ’š Become a Vabler and join a great team, fostering a culture of collaboration.

ðŸŽ¢ Join a company looking to scale and who understands people are their greatest asset.

ðŸŒ Be part of a fully remote and globally distributed team.

About you: ðŸ‘€

As a Data Analyst, your role is pivotal in driving data-driven decisions within Vable and ensuring our success with the data provided. In addition to our essential criteria we will be looking for the following mindset:


You're passionate about using data to solve complex problems and drive impactful change
You're self-motivated, work independently and take pride in delivering high-quality, impactful analysis
You proactively identify patterns, risks, and opportunities to build scalable, data-driven solutions
You're curious about how things work and how you can improve them
You're a collaborator who can build relationships across multiple teams, in an honest and meaningful way
You're structured and like organisation
You've an excellent work ethic and can manage workloads well
You are able to work effectively within a remote team, it can have its challenges



To be successful in this role, your values matter just as much as skills. Does this sound like you? âœ¨

ðŸŸ¢We are Kind and Empathetic = Our behaviour and words assume the best in people

ðŸŸ¢We are Always A Team = We are bound together by accountability

ðŸŸ¢We are Curious = A bunch from various backgrounds. We ask questions, plan things out, push the boundaries, challenge the status quo and welcome creativity

ðŸŸ¢We Take Ownership & Deliver = We are focused on our goals and love the details

âœ…Why work for Vable?


You want ownership of the Data Analytics within Vable
We have a culture that we protect, we value the contributions each Vabler makes
We encourage constant learning so you can keep up to date. A yearly budget of Â£250 is made available to each Vable employee for continuous learning and development
We encourage creativity and like new ideas and concentrate on the Cultural Add, not fit
We provide comprehensive healthcare cover following probation
You receive a MacBook, monitor and other required technical equipment when you join
33 days of paid leave a year inclusive of statutory holidays, based on where you live
Access to an Employee Assistance Programme through Oliva
We like our virtual socials and really do like to get to know everyone in the team
We are well established; we have been around for 20 years


âŒWhy it may not be for you:


We are a 40 hour week, Mon-Fri and have core hours, unless stated otherwise or agreed. Being a small remote team, it's how we operate
We have set norms and behaviours and each Vabler is expected to live up to these
While your primary focus will be on data analytics, you'll collaborate with various departments, addressing diverse needs and functions while adapting to shifting priorities. If you prefer a narrowly defined role, this may not be the right fit
We have various meetings per week and people are expected to attend and contribute
Our roles are quite generalist and you will be expected to do areas that you perhaps don't like or feel is not your job. No Vabler has this attitude and we get stuck in and pull our sleeves up. If this isn't you, best not apply.
Everyone has the opportunity to query, ask questions, have new ideas and we will give you our opinion. We operate on continuous feedback and recognition. This isn't for everyone and if this makes you uncomfortable or it's not your thing, this may not be the right fit
We are very transparent and all work is stored on shared drives. Colleagues will give input and it's expected that you will actively adhere to this approach



Interview Process ðŸ’Œ


Intro Call: You will meet a member of the People team for an initial discussion about your background, motivations and experience
Interview: If after the intro call, we're excited to proceed, you will be invited to a second stage interview with the Head of Product & Technology and another applicable manager. This stage will involve a task
Final Interview: Will be with the Head of Product & Technology


ðŸŽ¥ We record all of our interviews, with your permission. It makes it easier as we are globally distributed.

Vable is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment regardless of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or disability status.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Looking for a challenge in one of the worldâ€™s largest airfreight logistics organisations?

At IAG Cargo, we are in the business of moving things. From antibiotics to rhinoceroses, gold bullion to avocados, and everything in between. Whatever people need, wherever they are, IAG Cargo is there to bring them the necessary and niche.

As the logistics and cargo brand of International Airlines Group, you will work across the globally recognised brands of Aer Lingus, British Airways, Iberia, Level and Vueling. We believe in keeping the worldâ€™s economies turning, building a great place to work for our customers and colleague alike, and doing everything with Determined Attitudes, Curious Minds, Collaborative Actions and Heartfelt Pride.

About The Role

Become a vital part of a passionate team who are enabling IAG Cargo to make critical business decisions using leading edge data analytics. Bring a new perspective on data and how it can be used to solve challenges across the organisation. Your output will be essential in enabling insight driven decision-making within the business.

Partnering with core business areas our team of advanced analytics and reporting analysts will own a blended portfolio of analytical consultancy for smaller ad hoc and larger business driven projects, regular reports and dashboards feeding business processes. Each analyst will be responsible for providing a robust and reliable source of management information, delivering excellence in data visualisation, analytics and maintaining the quality of IAG Cargoâ€™s data through continuous improvement.

You should have a strong enthusiasm for problem solving and a passion for data. You will be expected to provide analytical expertise, seek to identify data gaps, and proactively develop the data agenda in line with business priorities as well as challenge business leaders to become truly data driven. A positive thinker with plenty of curiosity would be ideal for this role.

Itâ€™s all about you

We are eager to welcome individuals who demonstrate the IAG Cargo values:


Determined Attitudes â€“ a strong drive to succeed, a commitment to excellence, and sharp creative and strategic thinking
Heartfelt Pride â€“ going above and beyond, from day-to-day basics to large, long-term projects
Curious Mind â€“ an interest in the logistics and air cargo industry, and a fresh approach to traditional challenges
Collaborative Actions â€“ a proactive attitude, effective communication, and the desire to challenge the status quo and drive positive change


To Apply, Candidates Must


Hold (or demonstrate proof they will hold upon graduation) a 2:1 degree or above (or equivalent) in a STEM or other relevant degree within the last ten years
Have the right to live and work full-time in the UK for the duration of the programme


Weâ€™ll treat you right

As Well As a Competitive Salary Of Â£29,000, Bonus, 26 Daysâ€™ Holiday, Pension And Ability To Opt-in To a Generous Life Assurance And Healthcare Scheme, We Also Offer


Incredible staff discounts on hotels, car hire and our staff travel flights
Hybrid working, work from anywhere 20 days per year (subject to terms), and flexible bank holidays
Onsite staff parking, electric charging points and free airport parking when you are off globetrotting
Up to 75% off on the Heathrow Express with your staff pass
Access to LinkedIn Learning and Rosetta Stone Language courses
A free onsite gym, as well as access to the UNMIND wellbeing app and a community of mental health first aiders
Access to discounts on Apple products, cinema tickets and loads of other goodies
Free fruit and a subsidised onsite cafÃ©


What Our Graduates Say

â€œAs a graduate data analyst at IAG Cargo, I have had the opportunity to dive into data despite not coming from a data science background honing my analytical skills and also helped me build on soft skills too. The team you will be working alongside are more than happy to help with any queries no matter how big or small and will make you feel very welcome at every opportunity.â€ â€“ Michael Brady, Data, Insights and Operational Research Graduate

Each analyst will be responsible for providing a robust and reliable source of management information, delivering excellence in data visualisation, analytics and maintaining the quality of IAG Cargoâ€™s data through continuous improvement.

You should have a strong enthusiasm for problem solving and a passion for data. You will be expected to provide analytical expertise, seek to identify data gaps, and proactively develop the data agenda in line with business priorities as well as challenge business leaders to become truly data driven. A positive thinker with plenty of curiosity would be ideal for this role.

Itâ€™s all about you

We are eager to welcome individuals who demonstrate the IAG Cargo values:

  • Determined Attitudes â€“ a strong drive to succeed, a commitment to excellence, and sharp creative and strategic thinking
  • Heartfelt Pride â€“ going above and beyond, from day-to-day basics to large, long-term projects
  • Curious Mind â€“ an interest in the logistics and air cargo industry, and a fresh approach to traditional challenges
  • Collaborative Actions â€“ a proactive attitude, effective communication, and the desire to challenge the status quo and drive positive change

To Apply, Candidates Must

  • Hold (or demonstrate proof they will hold upon graduation) a 2:1 degree or above (or equivalent) in a STEM or other relevant degree within the last ten years
  • Have the right to live and work full-time in the UK for the duration of the programme

Weâ€™ll treat you right

As Well As a Competitive Salary Of Â£29,000, Bonus, 26 Daysâ€™ Holiday, Pension And Ability To Opt-in To a Generous Life Assurance And Healthcare Scheme, We Also Offer

  • Incredible staff discounts on hotels, car hire and our staff travel flights
  • Hybrid working, work from anywhere 20 days per year (subject to terms), and flexible bank holidays
  • Onsite staff parking, electric charging points and free airport parking when you are off globetrotting
  • Up to 75% off on the Heathrow Express with your staff pass
  • Access to LinkedIn Learning and Rosetta Stone Language courses
  • A free onsite gym, as well as access to the UNMIND wellbeing app and a community of mental health first aiders
  • Access to discounts on Apple products, cinema tickets and loads of other goodies
  • Free fruit and a subsidised onsite cafÃ©

What Our Graduates Say

â€œAs a graduate data analyst at IAG Cargo, I have had the opportunity to dive into data despite not coming from a data science background honing my analytical skills and also helped me build on soft skills too. The team you will be working alongside are more than happy to help with any queries no matter how big or small and will make you feel very welcome at every opportunity.â€ â€“ Michael Brady, Data, Insights and Operational Research Graduate

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

The goal is simple, to make healthy eating easy. To do this we need your support, building a scalable and maintainable eco-system that propels one of the UK's most loved start-ups forward. As a proud B-Corp we focus on using business as a force for good. We do this by balancing out people + planet with profit. For every recipe box bought we donate the equivalent of a school meal to a less developed country (over 19 million meals donated and counting...) and we have also pledged to go Net Zero by 2030 but there are so many other initiatives that we would love to tell you about!




If you would like to join one of the UKâ€™s most loved start-ups and make a positive impact on people's lives, then we would love to speak with you.




What we are looking for

We are looking for a Data Analyst with strong SQL and compelling story-telling skills to join our team. In this role youâ€™ll use your expertise to build clear and actionable data solutions, engaging with a wide range of stakeholders across our business. If youâ€™re enthusiastic about delivering concise insights and smart reporting, you will have a big impact at Mindful Chef.




You are

Experienced (3-5 years) as an Data Analyst, or similar role in a fast-paced, evolving environment.
Proficient in SQL, query building and explaining whatâ€™s going on â€œbehind the scenesâ€.
Experienced developing within data visualisation tools (Looker, Metabase, Tableau, PowerBI etc).
Knowledgeable about mobile and web analytics tools (Google Analytics, Amplitude etc).
A strong communicator, comfortable talking with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Well versed in business analytics and e-commerce concepts.
Proactive and happy working autonomously, always looking to find opportunities to enhance our data capabilities.




You will

Collaborate with various teams to understand their data needs, and build reporting and dashboards that provide self-serve solutions.
Translate complex data findings into easy-to-understand visualisations and reports for non-technical stakeholders.
Become a subject matter expert in our KPIs, able to explain the how and why of our business performance.
Support product development processes, extracting and providing value from our platform and user data.
Design and conduct experiments to test and evaluate the impact of user facing changes.
Identify areas for process automation, saving teams valuable time to work on the bigger picture.
Be intellectually honest and a champion for data accuracy, integrity and accessibility.

To name a few responsibilities - but at Mindful Chef there are always opportunities to take ownership, develop, and get exposure across the whole business.




Why us?

A competitive package that rewards your skills and dedication.
Flexibility of hybrid working from our office based in Wandsworth.
Be part of a Better Business (B-Corp), making a positive impact on profit, people, and planet.
Join an award-winning startup backed by the largest food and beverage company globally.
Experience a workplace that feels like home, complete with free meals, a gym, a vertical farm, and pet-friendly policies.
Prioritise your well-being with perks like Vitality health insurance, access to learning resources, mental health support, and a generous holiday package (30 days + bank holidays).
Enjoy a 50% discount on all Mindful Chef products.
Enhanced policy of 6 months full pay primary parental leave and 6 weeks full pay secondary parental leave.




About us

We are MINDFUL. This is intrinsic to everything we do. From the healthy recipes we design, to the local, expert and caring suppliers we select and the way we treat each other, our customers and our environment.




We are PERSONAL. We started Mindful Chef with our friends and families as customers and those are the kind of relationships we want to maintain however big we grow. Being real and true to ourselves and each other.




We are UNAFRAID. We want to be the best â€“ to challenge conventions, to think differently and be imaginative in how we solve problems. Brave enough to take on the big players and to do whatâ€™s right even when itâ€™s difficult.




Equal Opportunities

At Mindful Chef, we embrace diversity and inclusion as a foundation that enriches our culture and fuels the success of our business. We are mindful of everyoneâ€™s differences and we take pride in the unique perspectives, experiences, and talents that each individual brings to our team.

We are unafraid to tackle biases and challenge stereotypes, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute their personal strengths. Our commitment to diversity is not just a policy; it's a personal and collective responsibility that we take to heart.

We believe that by being mindful of our differences, unafraid to confront barriers, and embracing the personal stories and journeys of our team members, we can achieve greater innovation, creativity, and harmony in the workplace. Together we celebrate diversity, and together, we are better.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities:

The role requires the ability to actively manage concurrent projects and a strong talent for project coordination.

Reliable and timely environmental reporting including annual, quarterly, and monthly reporting from multiple data sources.

Collation, distillation, and analysis of large amounts of energy, waste and water data into coherent reports for internal and external audiences.

Ensuring data contained within the data management system is maintained to a consistently high standard, complies with client requirements, is accurate, consistent and integrated, does not contain any contradictory information, and can be used for internal and external reporting.

Work with client delivery and development teams to ensure program milestones are being met.

Develop a detailed understanding of data structures within clientâ€™s data.

Skills:

4-5 yearsâ€™ experience in similar analyst role.

Good understanding of the GRESB annual reporting requirement.

High proficiency in Microsoft Excel and data management.

Excellent communication skills including the ability to identify and describe data anomalies and provide solutions accordingly.

Lateral thinking and problem-solving skills.

Ability to multi-task and manage priorities to meet deadlines.

A strong desire to deliver a quality outcome for the client and end users.

Experience and understanding of sustainability and carbon emissions reporting will be a strong advantage.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Initial 6 month contract, with potential extensions

Ideally looking for an immediate start.




Our client a well known financial services company is currently hiring for a Data Analyst to be part of a global project team to work on a technology change project.




Within this role, you will be responsible for:




â€¢ Liaising with key SMEs to understand the data landscape and help scope and align the data sets used in investor reporting.

â€¢ Modelling data sources, roles & responsibilities, systems, flow and then assisting with requirement gathering for system development & integrations.

â€¢ Developing customised queries, reports and dashboards for project analytics

â€¢ Collaborating with stakeholders to develop a data migration approach

â€¢ Working with in house developers and the third-party vendor to problem solve data challenges and propose a sustainable data process between platforms.

â€¢ Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.

â€¢ Identify and define new data process improvement opportunities.




Essential Skills




Qualification or relevant professional experience in Business, Finance, or IT.
Must have experience working as a Data Analyst / Business Data Analyst.
Experience working on large data sets, including the use of ETL processes for the organisation of data.
Asset Management experience is essential
Previous experience as an Accountant/Fund Accountant
Onsite working required




Highly Desirable




Data or Business Analyst qualification.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Welwyn Garden City, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Join Our Team as a Data Analyst at PayPoint

Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey where you'll turn data into actionable insights? PayPoint is seeking a talented individual to join our team and play a crucial role in understanding customer behaviour, product performance, and retailer trends across all our products and business areas.




The team work in a Hybrid model, 2 days per week onsite at our Welwyn Garden City office.




Why choose PayPoint?

At PayPoint, we're committed to fostering an inclusive culture where everyone can thrive and contribute to our success. As a Data Analyst, you'll have the opportunity to make a real impact by translating data into meaningful insights that drive decision-making processes and support business growth.




What will you be doing?

Your role will involve a variety of responsibilities, including:

â€¢ Building fully automated reports to provide valuable insights to stakeholders and support decision-making.

â€¢ Tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) across the business to ensure effective monitoring and analysis.

â€¢ Collaborating with stakeholders and the Business Intelligence team to identify improvement opportunities and propose data-driven solutions.

â€¢ Developing dynamic reporting that effectively communicates how our customers or clients interact with our business.

â€¢ Evaluating the effectiveness of data sources and data-gathering techniques to enhance analysis and reporting.

â€¢ Staying up-to-date with the latest technology, techniques, and methods in data analysis.




What would we like from you?

â€¢ Expertise in Data Visualisation tools such as Power BI, Tableau, etc.

â€¢ Proficiency in data manipulation and programming in SQL.

â€¢ Excellent communication and presentation skills.

â€¢ Analytical mindset with excellent problem-solving skills.

â€¢ Ability to understand business requirements and effectively communicate results.

â€¢ Strong teamworking skills and a collaborative approach.

â€¢ Attention to detail and a passion for prioritising customer needs.

â€¢ A positive can-do attitude.




It would be great if you already haveâ€¦

â€¢ Salesforce reporting experience.

â€¢ Understanding of ETL processes.

â€¢ Knowledge of customer segmentation techniques and predictive analytics.

â€¢ Experience in campaign and impact analysis.

â€¢ Knowledge of best practices within SQL and Statistical Programming Languages (Python/R).




What can we do for you

We offer a range of benefits, including:

â€¢ Holiday purchase scheme, with 25 days holiday plus bank holidays.

â€¢ On-site gym (free) and nationwide corporate rate gym membership.

â€¢ Online benefits portal offering discounts on shopping and holidays.

â€¢ Love2Shop Everyday Benefits Card.

â€¢ Contributory company pension scheme.

â€¢ Progression and Development.

â€¢ Private medical insurance and life assurance (with option purchase additional cover

â€¢ Additional benefits available at a discounted rate.

â€¢ Cycle2Work scheme

â€¢ Electric Car Scheme




At PayPoint, we're committed to creating an inclusive culture where everyone can thrive and feel a sense of belonging. PayPoint is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.




Join us in shaping the future of technology at PayPoint. Apply today and embark on an exciting journey with us!

Title: Data Analyst (Commercial)
Description:
About us:

TotallyMoney is the free personal finance app that gives people the plans, products and help they need to unlock a life of more choices. It's all about creating a fairer financial world where people who've been left behind can make their financial data work for them. Put simply, we help them move closer towards their financial goals.

We're a diverse bunch from different backgrounds, united by a company culture that promotes autonomy, collaboration and innovation. We've even been voted one of the UK's Best Companies to Work For!

If you want to join our mission to help the UK's most under-served consumers â€” we want to hear from you!

What you'll do:

We're looking for a skilled and motivated Commercial Data Analyst to contribute to TotallyMoney's success by delivering data-driven insights, developing impactful data products, and enhancing commercial understanding across the business. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, commercial acumen, a collaborative outlook and a commitment to continuous improvement.

As part of the Data team, your responsibilities will include:


Analytics & Insight Generation: Supporting the creation and tracking of KPIs and performance metrics for the commercial team. Generating actionable insights to inform decisions on commercial strategy, product performance and market trends. Presenting findings in a clear, accessible format using a variety of data storytelling techniques. Collaborating with the commercial team to understand their priorities and goals and deliver insights to support the delivery of those goals
Data Product Development: Designing and delivering data products that drive business and commercial outcomes
Data Acquisition & Modelling: Collaborating with internal teams to identify their opportunities and problems and integrate external data sources to enhance analysis. Developing and refine data models in dbt to align with commercial priorities and business objectives
Data Quality & Governance: Complying with data quality frameworks to ensure reliable and accurate data. Upholding compliance with GDPR and other relevant regulations while supporting robust data governance practices


You'll fit in well if you're the kind of person who likes:


A Modern Data Stack: Working with data leaders to improve scalability and efficiency in analytics systems. Staying informed on industry trends and emerging technologies to support innovation



Requirements


Qualifications and skills:

Here's what we think you'll need to succeed in this role:


Experience in data analytics, data modelling, and insight generation
Familiarity with data governance practices and compliance regulations (e.g., GDPR)
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally
Exposure to modern data stack tools and cloud technologies is a plus
Previous experience in a commercial role e.g. Commercial Analyst or Manager is beneficial
Passion for leveraging data to drive business impact


If you're a data enthusiast eager to contribute to a fast-paced, innovative environment, we'd love to hear from you.

We know people, especially those from marginalised backgrounds, may hesitate to apply if they don't meet all the requirements. Please apply anyway. We don't expect you to be the complete package, just show us you have ambition and a willingness to learn.


Benefits


What you'll get from us:

Working at TotallyMoney has its perks. When you join the team you'll get:

Our commitment to diversity and inclusion:

At TotallyMoney, we're committed to being an inclusive and diverse employer, and welcome applications from all sections of society. We have an active DE&I (Diversity, Equity and Inclusion) committee led by employees and continually work on our DE&I efforts. HTML:
About us:

TotallyMoney is the free personal finance app that gives people the plans, products and help they need to unlock a life of more choices. It's all about creating a fairer financial world where people who've been left behind can make their financial data work for them. Put simply, we help them move closer towards their financial goals.

We're a diverse bunch from different backgrounds, united by a company culture that promotes autonomy, collaboration and innovation. We've even been voted one of the UK's Best Companies to Work For!

If you want to join our mission to help the UK's most under-served consumers â€” we want to hear from you!

What you'll do:

We're looking for a skilled and motivated Commercial Data Analyst to contribute to TotallyMoney's success by delivering data-driven insights, developing impactful data products, and enhancing commercial understanding across the business. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, commercial acumen, a collaborative outlook and a commitment to continuous improvement.

As part of the Data team, your responsibilities will include:

  • Analytics & Insight Generation: Supporting the creation and tracking of KPIs and performance metrics for the commercial team. Generating actionable insights to inform decisions on commercial strategy, product performance and market trends. Presenting findings in a clear, accessible format using a variety of data storytelling techniques. Collaborating with the commercial team to understand their priorities and goals and deliver insights to support the delivery of those goals
  • Data Product Development: Designing and delivering data products that drive business and commercial outcomes
  • Data Acquisition & Modelling: Collaborating with internal teams to identify their opportunities and problems and integrate external data sources to enhance analysis. Developing and refine data models in dbt to align with commercial priorities and business objectives
  • Data Quality & Governance: Complying with data quality frameworks to ensure reliable and accurate data. Upholding compliance with GDPR and other relevant regulations while supporting robust data governance practices

You'll fit in well if you're the kind of person who likes:

  • A Modern Data Stack: Working with data leaders to improve scalability and efficiency in analytics systems. Staying informed on industry trends and emerging technologies to support innovation


Requirements


Qualifications and skills:

Here's what we think you'll need to succeed in this role:

  • Experience in data analytics, data modelling, and insight generation
  • Familiarity with data governance practices and compliance regulations (e.g., GDPR)
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally
  • Exposure to modern data stack tools and cloud technologies is a plus
  • Previous experience in a commercial role e.g. Commercial Analyst or Manager is beneficial
  • Passion for leveraging data to drive business impact

If you're a data enthusiast eager to contribute to a fast-paced, innovative environment, we'd love to hear from you.

We know people, especially those from marginalised backgrounds, may hesitate to apply if they don't meet all the requirements. Please apply anyway. We don't expect you to be the complete package, just show us you have ambition and a willingness to learn.


Benefits

  • â›±ï¸ 25 days of annual leave (plus 8 bank holidays), 2 additional free days off at Christmas time, and the option to purchase an extra week off
  • ðŸŒ… 40 days to work abroad â€” make us jealous of your stunning view
  • ðŸ¼ Parental leave so you can spend time with your new bundle of joy
  • ðŸ’œ 2 days leave to volunteer for whatever causes you're passionate about! Plus, the opportunity to give back during work with a range of monthly charity events
  • ðŸ˜· Unlimited sick leave so you can take the time you need to get better

Title: Product Analyst / Data Analyst
Description:
Product Analyst




Are you passionate about data and driving strategic growth?




This is an amazing opportunity with a London based FinTech who are scaling fast! I am looking for a Data Analyst to join the innovative Product Strategy team to own key metrics, deliver actionable insights, and collaborate with diverse stakeholders to make a real impact, read more!




What youâ€™ll do:

Take ownership of critical metrics and lead key initiatives, driving business success by ensuring accurate conclusions and insights.
Analyse factors influencing customer retention and spending, assess the financial impact of initiatives, and identify opportunities for product optimisation and growth.
Deliver actionable recommendations to stakeholders, including the C-suite, with a focus on automating decision-making processes.
Develop scalable tools and solutions to support self-service analytics.
Collaborate with the data team to enhance technical capabilities and improve workflows.
Design and implement optimised data models in the data warehouse using DBT.




Requirements:

Over 4 years of experience in data analytics, ideally within product analytics or strategic data roles.
Advanced/ expert SQL skills and experience in building dashboards.
Strong business acumen with a track record in commercially or product-focused data environments.
A problem-solving mindset, with the ability to tackle undefined challenges and navigate an evolving roadmap.
Proactivity, resourcefulness, and the ability to deliver clear insights in ambiguous situations.
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, including presenting results to senior leadership.
A proven ability to build robust and reliable data sets with high levels of control.
Expertise in applying various analytics techniques, statistical analysis, A/B testing, and data visualisation tools.




Why join us?

Youâ€™ll be part of a forward-thinking team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence. If you thrive in dynamic environments and love turning data into actionable strategies, please apply! You will need to be in the London office 3 days a week (Monday, Tuesday and Thursday).

Title: Data Analyst - Subscriptions
Description:
Data Analyst / Subscriptions / PowerBI / Analytics /




Location: Central London




Salary: Circa Â£50,000 - Â£70,000 + Package




Permanent




Currently recruiting for a growing digital client who are looking to hire a data analyst with strong subscriptions / audience experience along with expertise within PowerBI and analytics.




Broad responsibility role in a fast paced, innovative environment.




Will be comfortable engaging with various stakeholders and teams to provide reporting and ad-hoc analysis and insights within existing data warehouse and various data sources. These insights will provide a lot of value in driving forward the subscriptions arm of the business.




Experience within PowerBI development and visualisation including DAX and M is also key.




Please apply for more information on the client and full JD.




Responsibilities / Skills




Utilise data / insight analysis to support subscription growth
Create and define data models for automated reporting
Work on segmentations
Create new and enhance existing Power BI Reports
Determine and ensure correct data and analytics flows
Engage with audience and product stakeholders to collect and understand data and insight requirements.
Experience within data/audience analytics and Power BI development.
Strong experience with Adobe Analytics, GA, similar.
Strong Experience with marketing and targeting data from Social Media Platforms
Strong experience in Power BI development & visualizations including DAX and M as well as connecting to SQL and non-SQL data sources.
Strong experience in creating data models in Power BI and Power BI Service.
High level of attention to details and thoroughness.
Experienced in SQL to perform data quality assessments and ad hoc analysis.
Good understanding of data migration/ETL processes, data management, and relational data models.
Confident, motivated, proactive, focussed on business objectives and a strong communicator.
Ability to think data end-to-end.
Degree educated within numerical, science, computer science (desirable)

Title: Data Analyst - Commercial
Description:
THE CARWOW GROUP

Carwow Group is driven by a passion for getting people into cars. But not just any car, the right car. That's why we are building the go-to destination for car-changing. Designed to reach drivers everywhere with our trail-blazing portfolio of personality rich automotive brands; Carwow, Auto Express, evo, Driving Electric and Car Buyer.

What started as a simple reviews site, is now one of the largest online car-changing destinations in Europe - over 10m customers have used Carwow to help them buy and sell cars since its inception. Last year we grew over 50% with nearly Â£3bn worth of cars bought on site, while Â£1.8bn of cars were listed for sale through our Sell My Car service.

In 2024 we went big and acquired Autovia, doubling our audience overnight. Together we now have one of the biggest YouTube channels in the world with over 1.1 billion annual views, sell 1.2 million print copies of our magazines and have an annual web content reach over 350million.

WHY JOIN US?

We are winners of the prestigious Culture 100 award that recognises the most loved and happiest tech companies to work for! We have just raised $52m in funding led by global venture capital firm Bessemer Venture Partners (an early backer of LinkedIn and Shopify) to accelerate our growth plans!

As pioneers, we're always driving for new territory and positive change, so our work as a group is never done. Where others see difficulty, it's our responsibility to see possibility - building new experiences, launching new titles and listening to drivers.

Being a part of Carwow Group means championing drivers and the automotive industry, acting as a disrupter and never being afraid to fail (but learning fast when we do!).

Our team of 500 employees across the UK, Germany, Spain and Portugal are revolutionising car-changing and we are fast expanding our mission across every single brand and country we operate in, so jump in!

THE ROLE

Want to make your mark within a fast-moving industry? We are seeking a highly motivated and detail oriented Data Analyst to join our Marketplace Analytics team here at Carwow. You will play a key role in improving our proposition for users on both sides of our marketplace, through analysing and interpreting data to provide actionable insights, and developing crucial business reporting to contribute to our data driven decision making. You will utilise your commercial awareness and analytical expertise to discover the insights that change the status quo and accelerate the growth of the company exponentially.

The role sits within the Analytics & Data Science team to benefit from the wider expertise but is closely aligned with Commercial stakeholders to enable us to deliver the most impactful analysis by fully understanding business questions and problems that we need to solve.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with commercial leaders and account managers to understand their specific business problems
Combine data from multiple sources to generate actionable insights that highlight new opportunities and drive revenue
Work closely with our commercial teams to generate and maintain dynamic dashboards and reports that visualise key performance indicators, enabling self-serve and informed stakeholder decisions
Regularly conduct validation and quality checks on our data sets to ensure accuracy and reliability while recommending opportunities to improve how we assess commercial performance
Develop an understanding of how our commercial teams work, and ensure this is considered by the wider Analytics team
Create regular ad hoc reporting and analysis, with the ability to present findings to both technical and non technical audiences
Support the wider analytics and data science community here at carwow, with knowledge shares and peer programming


What You'll Need

Please note{â€‹{:}} We know that no candidate will be the perfect match for all we've listed in this posting, so we'd encourage you to apply if you feel you're close to the brief but not an exact match

Title: Digital Data Analyst
Description:
About Seraphine:

Seraphine is a global leader in maternity and nursing wear. With over two decades of experience. What we do at Seraphine is more than just fashion and clothes. We help women feel confident in their changing bodies and enable them to continue to express the choice and style they had prior to pregnancy and during pregnancy, whilst providing them with product innovations that make motherhood a breeze.

We're more than just a clothing brand. We're a community that understands the unique needs and challenges of expectant and new mothers. Our commitment to quality, comfort, and style has made us a trusted choice for women worldwide.

Workplace and Culture:

Driven by innovation and a passion for excellence, our team thrives on achieving market-leading results. We value resourcefulness, dependability, and diverse perspectives, fostering a culture of go-getters who push boundaries every day. At Seraphine, we do what we love and invite exceptional individuals from all backgrounds to join us on this exciting journey.

Your role, should you choose to apply, is to decipher complex data and story-tell by numbers (more formulas, less fairytales!)


Ensure digital data is accurately tracked, maintained and collated across all digital data points (customer, website, product, marketing)
Use existing analytics platforms and proprietary analysis to develop insightful reporting processes, enabling broader team to prioritise their time according to 'bang for buck'
Proactively dig into areas of opportunity and cut-through data complexity to create a clear narrative of the different digital dynamics within the business
You will be responsible for providing insight and reporting across all digital data points; some will exist already, others you will need to implement
Reporting into the Head of Digital Experience, with a dotted line to the CMO, you will need to paint a picture of on-site customer behaviour from GA4 and highlight areas of opportunity for others to spring into action on.
You'll be the abassador for data quality, working with the dev team on surfacing the right attributes in the data layer - the devil is in the detail
'Test and learn' will be your mantra - and you'll have the benefit of watching the team iterate various CRO tests and will be measuring success (or not!) every step of the way
As well as on site behaviour from GA4, you'll need to use your analytical Excel and SQL skills to analyse large data sets for customer KPIs, sales reporting and digital marketing analysis



Requirements


Minimum of 3 years data analyst experience
GA4 Reporting including detailed knowledge on tag manager and event tracking
Basic to intermediate SQL skills
Data analysis, reporting and forecasting - Advanced Excel
Detail oriented with strong analytical background and a penchant for Excel formulas



Benefits


Annual leave entitlement - 25 days FTE paid holiday + any bank/public holidays.
Birthday Leave - Paid day off for birthday to be taken within 30-day time frame
Early finish Friday - Early finish on Fridays at 3pm (or another agreed day)
Core Hours - Core hours are from 10:00am - 4:30pm
Staff discount - Employee will be entitled to 50% off on full-price & 20% on sale items
Life Assurance - Insured for a lump sum benefit of 4 x their basic annual salary, which shall be paid tax free at the discretion of the trustees to their nominated beneficiary
Income Protection - if an employee is unable to work, as a result of illness or injury for a prolonged period, they will be entitled to a monthly payment of 50% of their salary.
Auto-enrolment Pension Scheme - 5% Employee and 3% Employer contribution
Employee discount benefits via Enjoy Benefits Hub:
Gadget Insurance
Cancer Screening
Pet Insurance
Lottie - Care Home Discount
Health & Wellbeing Videos


Upon successful completion of the probationary period:


Salary Exchange Benefits via Enjoy Benefits Hub:
Enjoy Technology/Mobile Phones - 2 orders per year Â£1000 limit per order
Will Writing - Â£800 limit (Discounted rate)
Holiday Exchange Buy/Sell - up to 5 days max.
Workplace Nursery (saves both Tax and NI)
Gym Benefit - Â£1000 limit (Saves NI and fees are reduced by 10%-25%)
Cycle 2 Work - max Â£4,500 limit (Save NI and possible Tax depending on income)


Health Cash Plan: Medicash - Claim back the total or some costs of several health related services, such as Dental Treatment, Eye Tests/Glasses, Physio etc.

On the completion of 1 years' service:


Electric Car Scheme - 1 car per person (Salary sacrifice)
Enhanced Maternity/Paternity Leave
Show more
HTML:
About Seraphine:

Seraphine is a global leader in maternity and nursing wear. With over two decades of experience. What we do at Seraphine is more than just fashion and clothes. We help women feel confident in their changing bodies and enable them to continue to express the choice and style they had prior to pregnancy and during pregnancy, whilst providing them with product innovations that make motherhood a breeze.

We're more than just a clothing brand. We're a community that understands the unique needs and challenges of expectant and new mothers. Our commitment to quality, comfort, and style has made us a trusted choice for women worldwide.

Workplace and Culture:

Driven by innovation and a passion for excellence, our team thrives on achieving market-leading results. We value resourcefulness, dependability, and diverse perspectives, fostering a culture of go-getters who push boundaries every day. At Seraphine, we do what we love and invite exceptional individuals from all backgrounds to join us on this exciting journey.

Your role, should you choose to apply, is to decipher complex data and story-tell by numbers (more formulas, less fairytales!)

  • Ensure digital data is accurately tracked, maintained and collated across all digital data points (customer, website, product, marketing)
  • Use existing analytics platforms and proprietary analysis to develop insightful reporting processes, enabling broader team to prioritise their time according to 'bang for buck'
  • Proactively dig into areas of opportunity and cut-through data complexity to create a clear narrative of the different digital dynamics within the business
  • You will be responsible for providing insight and reporting across all digital data points; some will exist already, others you will need to implement
  • Reporting into the Head of Digital Experience, with a dotted line to the CMO, you will need to paint a picture of on-site customer behaviour from GA4 and highlight areas of opportunity for others to spring into action on.
  • You'll be the abassador for data quality, working with the dev team on surfacing the right attributes in the data layer - the devil is in the detail
  • 'Test and learn' will be your mantra - and you'll have the benefit of watching the team iterate various CRO tests and will be measuring success (or not!) every step of the way
  • As well as on site behaviour from GA4, you'll need to use your analytical Excel and SQL skills to analyse large data sets for customer KPIs, sales reporting and digital marketing analysis


Requirements

  • Minimum of 3 years data analyst experience
  • GA4 Reporting including detailed knowledge on tag manager and event tracking
  • Basic to intermediate SQL skills
  • Data analysis, reporting and forecasting - Advanced Excel
  • Detail oriented with strong analytical background and a penchant for Excel formulas


Benefits

  • Annual leave entitlement - 25 days FTE paid holiday + any bank/public holidays.
  • Birthday Leave - Paid day off for birthday to be taken within 30-day time frame
  • Early finish Friday - Early finish on Fridays at 3pm (or another agreed day)
  • Core Hours - Core hours are from 10:00am - 4:30pm
  • Staff discount - Employee will be entitled to 50% off on full-price & 20% on sale items
  • Life Assurance - Insured for a lump sum benefit of 4 x their basic annual salary, which shall be paid tax free at the discretion of the trustees to their nominated beneficiary
  • Income Protection - if an employee is unable to work, as a result of illness or injury for a prolonged period, they will be entitled to a monthly payment of 50% of their salary.
  • Auto-enrolment Pension Scheme - 5% Employee and 3% Employer contribution
  • Employee discount benefits via Enjoy Benefits Hub:
  • Gadget Insurance
  • Cancer Screening
  • Pet Insurance
  • Lottie - Care Home Discount
  • Health & Wellbeing Videos

Upon successful completion of the probationary period:

  • Salary Exchange Benefits via Enjoy Benefits Hub:
  • Enjoy Technology/Mobile Phones - 2 orders per year Â£1000 limit per order
  • Will Writing - Â£800 limit (Discounted rate)
  • Holiday Exchange Buy/Sell - up to 5 days max.
  • Workplace Nursery (saves both Tax and NI)
  • Gym Benefit - Â£1000 limit (Saves NI and fees are reduced by 10%-25%)
  • Cycle 2 Work - max Â£4,500 limit (Save NI and possible Tax depending on income)

Health Cash Plan: Medicash - Claim back the total or some costs of several health related services, such as Dental Treatment, Eye Tests/Glasses, Physio etc.

On the completion of 1 years' service:

  • Electric Car Scheme - 1 car per person (Salary sacrifice)
  • Enhanced Maternity/Paternity Leave

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Insight Global are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join a leading education consultancy based in Soho, London. This hybrid role requires three days per week in-office and is a full-time, permanent position.




This is a newly created position, designed to strategically enhance the firmâ€™s data analytics capabilities, building on the success of ongoing projects. In this role, you will support key initiatives such as supplier analysis, client evaluations, M&A activities, and operational reviews. You will also recommend and implement new processes and methodologies to streamline both the data management and analysis.




Working closely with consultants, you will analyse data, derive insights, and present findings to clients. Additionally, you will evaluate current workflows, recommend tools or techniques to enhance efficiency, and guide the firm in adopting innovative data strategies to help optimise and enhance their client offerings.




Key Responsibilities:

â€¢ Support consultancy projects by providing data-driven insights and recommendations.

â€¢ Develop and implement methodologies to streamline data manipulation and analysis beyond Excel.

â€¢ Analyse and interpret data to deliver actionable insights that align with project goals.

â€¢ Present tailored methodologies and findings to partners and external clients with confidence.

â€¢ Recommend tools, processes, and techniques to improve operational efficiency and data management.

â€¢ Leverage data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to create impactful dashboards and reports.




Must-Have Skills:

â€¢ Proven experience supporting consultancy projects from a data analytics perspective.

â€¢ Strong numerical and analytical skills with the ability to develop innovative methodologies.

â€¢ Expertise in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar software.

â€¢ Excellent analytical thinking, with the ability to extract meaningful insights and present data-driven narratives.

â€¢ Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

â€¢ A proactive mindset, capable of taking initiative and delivering tailored recommendations.

â€¢ Bachelorâ€™s degree in Data Science, Statistics, or a related field.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

â€¢ Previous experience working in consultancy roles focused on the education sector.

Strong Data Analyst background

Title: Data Analyst, CRM Product Marketing
Description:
Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Fruitz and Official. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through kind connections. Founded by CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble BFF) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Fruitz, founded in 2017, encourages open and honest communication of dating intentions through playful fruit metaphors. Official is an app for couples that promotes open and honest communication between partners and was founded in 2020.

Bumble Inc. is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to work with our Growth Product Marketing and CRM stakeholders, take an integrated ecosystem approach and support critical business decisions across all our apps.

This is a unique opportunity for an experienced analyst who enjoys the fast-paced environment of a growing company and has a passion to contribute to helping the Bumble Inc. mission to foster kind connections. You would ideally have an extensive background in product and CRM analytics at an app-based tech company, with proven experience in experimentation, AB testing and causal inference.




What you'll do:
You will act as a thought partner to the CRM/Growth Product Marketing team and provide them with training, guidance and support on experimentation, measurement and results interpretation
You will consistently push for best practices and influence the cross-functional team to drive better decisions informed by dataÂ Â 
You will deliver analytical roadmaps to support the longer-term vision of Growth Product Marketing within the business. This includes reporting, handling of ad-hoc requests and data visibility, experimentation, and ongoing measurement of CRM campaigns
You will analyse customer data with respect to CRM campaigns (including push notifications, promo cards, and other in-app communication) and identify opportunities for improvement in customer engagement and retention strategies
You will contribute to enhancing data and reporting capabilities as it relates to the Growth Product Marketing domain, proactively working with CRM Product Managers, Engineering and other teamsÂ 
You will build and manage self-serve data products, a knowledge base of insights, and provide direct support, to empower others to fully understand the value of data in their day-to-day work





About you:
Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome
3+ years of experience in data science and analytics preferably in Product and CRM domains with expertise in experimentation, AB testing and causal inference
Proven commercial experience serving as a thought partner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Preference for experience working in similar dating/social/gaming tech product industries or else app-based product, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and partnering with data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases
Strong experience with SQL and Python, Looker or a similar visualisation platform. Familiarity with DBT is a plus
You keep an eye out on the industry, understanding how the wider dating industry influences our business strategies








Global benefits

Maven FertilityÂ We offer a $10,000 lifetime benefit opportunity to all employees and their partners around the world. This benefit can be used to support your reproductive journey - from abortion care and related travel costs to fertility treatment, egg-freezing, adoption, surrogacy, and more.Â 

Family & compassionate paid leaveFamily leave to support you and your loved ones when needed (including victim of domestic abuse or violent crime).

26 weeks parental leaveÂ 26 weeks paid leave for the primary caregiver following the birth, adoption, surrogacy or foster care of a child. The secondary caregiver will also receive 26 weeks paid leave after 1 year of employment.

Unlimited paid time offTake the time you need when you need it.Â 

Company-wide week offTwice a year, we have a company-wide week off (itâ€™s essential for some teams to continue working and they will be offered alternative time off instead).

Focus FridaysTwice a month we have a no meeting, no deadline, no email and no Slack rule on a Friday so you can focus without distraction.

Check out more of our local benefits here.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Looking for a challenge in one of the worldâ€™s largest airfreight logistics organisations?


At IAG Cargo, we are in the business of moving things. From antibiotics to rhinoceroses, gold bullion to avocados, and everything in between. Whatever people need, wherever they are, IAG Cargo is there to bring them the necessary and niche.


As the logistics and cargo brand of International Airlines Group, you will work across the globally recognised brands of Aer Lingus, British Airways, Iberia, Level and Vueling. We believe in keeping the worldâ€™s economies turning, building a great place to work for our customers and colleague alike, and doing everything with Determined Attitudes, Curious Minds, Collaborative Actions and Heartfelt Pride.


About the role


Become a vital part of a passionate team who are enabling IAG Cargo to make critical business decisions using leading edge data analytics. Bring a new perspective on data and how it can be used to solve challenges across the organisation. Your output will be essential in enabling insight driven decision-making within the business.

Partnering with core business areas our team of advanced analytics and reporting analysts will own a blended portfolio of analytical consultancy for smaller ad hoc and larger business driven projects, regular reports and dashboards feeding business processes. Each analyst will be responsible for providing a robust and reliable source of management information, delivering excellence in data visualisation, analytics and maintaining the quality of IAG Cargoâ€™s data through continuous improvement.

You should have a strong enthusiasm for problem solving and a passion for data. You will be expected to provide analytical expertise, seek to identify data gaps, and proactively develop the data agenda in line with business priorities as well as challenge business leaders to become truly data driven. A positive thinker with plenty of curiosity would be ideal for this role.


Itâ€™s all about you


We are eager to welcome individuals who demonstrate the IAG Cargo values:

Determined Attitudes â€“ a strong drive to succeed, a commitment to excellence, and sharp creative and strategic thinking
Heartfelt Pride â€“ going above and beyond, from day-to-day basics to large, long-term projects
Curious Mind â€“ an interest in the logistics and air cargo industry, and a fresh approach to traditional challenges
Collaborative Actions â€“ a proactive attitude, effective communication, and the desire to challenge the status quo and drive positive change

To apply, candidates must:

Hold (or demonstrate proof they will hold upon graduation) a 2:1 degree or above (or equivalent) in a STEM or other relevant degree within the last ten years
Have the right to live and work full-time in the UK for the duration of the programme
Weâ€™ll treat you right


As well as a competitive salary of Â£29,000, bonus, 26 daysâ€™ holiday, pension and ability to opt-in to a generous life assurance and healthcare scheme, we also offer:

Incredible staff discounts on hotels, car hire and our staff travel flights
Hybrid working, work from anywhere 20 days per year (subject to terms), and flexible bank holidays
Onsite staff parking, electric charging points and free airport parking when you are off globetrotting
Up to 75% off on the Heathrow Express with your staff pass
Access to LinkedIn Learning and Rosetta Stone Language courses
A free onsite gym, as well as access to the UNMIND wellbeing app and a community of mental health first aiders
Access to discounts on Apple products, cinema tickets and loads of other goodies
Free fruit and a subsidised onsite cafÃ©

What our Graduates say

â€œAs a graduate data analyst at IAG Cargo, I have had the opportunity to dive into data despite not coming from a data science background honing my analytical skills and also helped me build on soft skills too. The team you will be working alongside are more than happy to help with any queries no matter how big or small and will make you feel very welcome at every opportunity.â€ â€“ Michael Brady, Data, Insights and Operational Research Graduate

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ðŸ§¢Role | Data Analyst

ðŸ¢Sector | Retrofit Architects

ðŸŽ¯Responsibilities | Drive meaningful decision-making through the power of data. You'll develop visualisations, dashboards, and reports while collaborating closely with multidisciplinary teams to enhance data quality, accessibility, and analysis.

â­Purpose | Your expertise will directly contribute to decarbonising schools.

ðŸ“Based | London Waterloo / hybrid.

âŒšFull-time | 40 hours per week (9am-6pm)

ðŸ’°Salary | up to Â£40,000




Our client, an architect-led company addressing the climate emergency through school decarbonisation and knowledge-building, is looking for a Data Analyst to support their mission of decarbonising schools. In this role, you'll use your expertise to help architect and non-architect teams understand, interpret, and improve their data for multiple, critical projects.




To excel in this role, you will:




Use tools such as SQL, R, or Python to manipulate, clean, and model data.
Build and deliver interactive dashboards, impactful visualisations, and reports tailored to usersâ€™ needs.
Apply innovative analytical techniques to create actionable insights.
Collaborate with architect and non-architect teams to plan better use of data and support improved decision-making.
Combine quantitative and qualitative data to deliver rich user insights and support strategic development.
Apply modern analytical techniques to interpret complex data sets, uncover actionable insights, and support strategic development.
Collaborate across teams to plan data roadmaps, improve data quality, and support innovation projects.
Take a proactive, hands-on approach to resolving data issues and addressing internal data-driven needs, you must be comfortable with both operational and strategic tasks.




Skills You Bring:

A track record of using statistical data analysis frameworks and techniques on large data sets (expertise with projects related to the built environment a bonus), including cleaning and filtering data.
Strong mathematical and statistical skills for analysing messy, complex data.
Creative problem-solving and an ability to think strategically about data patterns and their implications.
Exceptional communication skills to translate technical insights into practical recommendations.




Experience

Experience in building data roadmaps, dashboards, and algorithms to inform decisions.
Proven experience interpreting data and delivering clear, actionable insights to stakeholders.
Track record of working collaboratively in cross-functional teams and building positive relationships with stakeholders.
Strong communication skills to present findings and recommendations effectively.




The team values innovation, collaboration, and a can-do attitude. If you're passionate about using data to create meaningful impact and enjoy working in a dynamic environment, we'd love to hear from you.




This role may require enhanced DBS checks.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Iâ€™m working on behalf of a Leading Asset Management firm who are looking to hire a Data Analyst on a 12-month contract as part of their growing ESG initiative.




This role will provide ongoing BAU maintenance to the current MS Access Database and assist with an upcoming data migration project.




Key Responsibilities:

Provide technical leadership and ongoing support for MS Access databases, ensuring smooth operation and implementing necessary changes
Lead data documentation and mapping efforts, collaborating with cross-functional teams to assess and recommend system improvements or replacements for MS Access.
Act as the technical representative in decision-making reviews and identify opportunities for greater data integration across systems and processes.

Skills & Experience:

Expertise in MS Access, including forms, queries, reports, and VBA.
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts for non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with modern data solutions (e.g., Snowflake, Alteryx, Microsoft Power Platform) is a plus.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and work independently.
1-3 yrs experience in similar role

  • Act as the technical representative in decision-making reviews and identify opportunities for greater data integration across systems and processes.

  • Expertise in MS Access, including forms, queries, reports, and VBA.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts for non-technical stakeholders.
  • Experience with modern data solutions (e.g., Snowflake, Alteryx, Microsoft Power Platform) is a plus.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and work independently.
  • 1-3 yrs experience in similar role

Title: Data Analyst - Business Intelligence
Description:
Are you ready to write your next chapter?

Make your mark at one of the biggest names in payments. With proven technology, we process the largest volume of payments in the world, driving the global economy every day. When you join Worldpay, you join a global community of experts and changemakers, working to reinvent an industry by constantly evolving how we work and making the way millions of people pay easier, every day.

What makes a Worldpayer? Itâ€™s simple: Think, Act, Win. We stay curious, always asking the right questions to be better every day, finding creative solutions to simplify the complex. Weâ€™re dynamic, every Worldpayer is empowered to make the right decisions for their customers. And weâ€™re determined, always staying open â€“ winning and failing as one.

Weâ€™re looking for Data Analyst to join our ever-evolving team to help us unleash the potential of every business.

Are you ready to make your mark? Then you sound like a Worldpayer.

About The Team

You will be working as a key member of the Operations Intelligence team responsible for data and insights into the Enterprise operations. Youâ€™ll be joining a team that is at the heart of what Worldpay deliver for our merchants that operate across the globe.

As part of the wider Enterprise Operations team, you will be a fundamental component of driving the change in Worldpayâ€™s Enterprise offering through the delivery of insights.

The payments industry is going through a period of rapid change and growth, and insights into customers and our operations to support customer needs is critical to win in this space. This opportunity would put you at the centre of this, driving insights to inform business strategy.

The role is London based although the overall Enterprise Operations team is spread across the UK and other countries.

What Youâ€™ll Own

You will support the Enterprise Operations teams by:


Delivering reports, dashboards and ad hoc insights into end-to-end operations performance and trends, investigating data anomalies and ensuring a single source of truth
Compile data from various sources into a single, consumable, data set, including design and implementation of data models
Working with operational leaders to drive performance & process improvements
Interpreting data to discover patterns and identify trends, you will create timely, relevant and actionable insights that will be highly impactful
Work with business leaders to identify, define and develop new metrics that will track performance and highlight potential inefficiencies
Continuously improving & automating internal processes


Where youâ€™ll own it

Youâ€™ll own it in our London hub. Our sites are hubs of activity, conversation, and openness. With inspiring, stylish workspaces we want people to feel excited to come and do their best work.

What You Bring


Bachelorâ€™s degree in engineering, Math, Data Analytics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business or another degree with quantitative focus
3+ years related experience, working with varied and complex data, and collaborating with business leaders to drive meaningful change through insight.
Experience in Querying, extracting, and transforming large data sets and leveraging data from various sources. Proficiency in programming languages such as SQL
Experience building insightful and intuitive dashboards using visualisation tools e.g. PowerBI.
Strong Excel skills, and extensive experience using Excel for analysis.
The ability to transform data into insights which can be presented/communicated to senior stakeholders across the business.
Proactive and inquisitive mindset, with a drive & passion to work with business teams to drive improvements. Strong sense of ownership and proactivity in whatever work you deliver.
Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
You will be a collaborative team player


Worldpay Perks - What Weâ€™ll Bring For You

We know itâ€™s bigger than just your career. Itâ€™s your life, and your world. Thatâ€™s why we offer global benefits and programs to support you at every stage. Hereâ€™s a taste of what you can expect.


A competitive salary and benefits.
Time to support charities and give back to your community.
Parental leave policy.
Global recognition platform.
Virgin Pulse access.
Global employee assistance program.


What Makes a Worldpayer

At Worldpay, we take our Values seriously, and we live them every day. Think like a customer, Act like an owner, and Win as a team.


Curious. Humble. Creative. We ask the right questions, listening and learning to get better every day. We simplify the complex and weâ€™re always looking to create a bigger impact for our colleagues and customers.
Empowered. Accountable. Dynamic. We stay agile, using our initiative, taking calculated risks to progress. Never standing still, never settling, we work at pace to achieve our goals. We champion our ideas and stay flexible to make them happen. We know that every action adds up.
Determined. Inclusive. Open. Unlocking potential means working as one global community. Our work spans borders, and we stay united by our purpose. We collaborate, always encouraging others to perform at their best, welcoming new perspectives.


Does this sound like you? Then you sound like a Worldpayer.

Apply now to write the next chapter in your career. We canâ€™t wait to hear from you.

Privacy Statement

Worldpay is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how Worldpay protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.

Sourcing Model

Recruitment at Worldpay works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. Worldpay does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.
