Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are working with a leading Cross-border Payment business who are currently looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join their Product & Technology team. You will work closely with the product and tech teams to build dashboards, understand business data needs, and support rollout as the company continues to grow.




This is the first Data Analyst hire for them so there is a lot of scope for personal development and growth within the business as well as establishing a strong data function in a rapidly scaling Fintech.




Responsibilities:

Provide regular reporting to the Product and Technology Director as required
Work with Product and Tech teams to understand data needs and provide data-driven insights
Build dashboards and reports to track business metrics and KPIs
Support rollout of new products and features
Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders, and support and host discussions within a multidisciplinary team
Be an advocate for data in the business, share knowledge and support the wider business with adopting data-led decision making
Ensure data management and governance processes are in place and adhered to for the products and services your teams provide, and define strategies to enable continual improvement of data management practices and compliance with data governance policies.
Build and review complex data models, ensuring adherence to standards.
Utilise data integration tools and languages to integrate and store data, and advise teams on best practice.




Competencies & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g. statistics, mathematics, computer science)
4 years of experience as a data analyst
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with SQL, Excel, and/or Python
Experience with AWS data related solutions including: Redshift, Glue, Athena, Aurora




2 days WFH/3 days in the office - Central London Office

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join one of London's newest and most exciting Media Agencies. Around 40 people having grown incrementally over the past 4 years they are one of the best places to join right now.




Having been awarded some industry-leading awards their culture is one of the best places to work. You'll join a business that imbraces diversity and has a great benefits package.




They are hiring a new role, a Data Analyst.




Responsibilities:




Expertise in UK media platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Meta, Programmatic).




Deliver accurate, timely client reports and insights.




Collaborate on data strategies to drive growth across performance and brand marketing.




Lead data visualization projects and client reporting dashboards.




Oversee smooth client onboarding and build strong relationships.




Analyze data for actionable insights to optimize results.




Contribute to pitching data services and measurement strategies.




Stay current with industry trends and new data opportunities.




Skills Needed:




3+ years in media analytics




Strong interest in data and consumer behavior.




Excellent presentation and communication skills.




Knowledge of pixels, tags, and market trends (AI, DCO, customer data).




Ability to build relationships with clients and partners.




Broad understanding of digital marketing (social, search, programmatic).




Organized, detail-oriented, and collaborative.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Business Analyst - Data Analyst - DataSet - Runbook - Paying up to Â£400 (outside IR35) - Hybrid - Immediately Starters

My clients goal is to accelerate their understanding of the data related to enquiries. They want to better understand the main reasons why customers are declining and also how price sensitive our customers are.

They need a Data Analyst with strong experience in working with tech first companies and although will be part of a wider they need to be self motivated.

Key Skills:

EngagewiththeteamtoIdentify where the relevant data is
Identify modifications required to the format to make it consumable
Store and organise the relevant data
Analyse the information
Create repeatable mechanisms so the process can be run again (this can be a runbook)
Create a report with the insights for declined quotes and price sensitivity

Key Deliverables:

DataSet: Organised raw data
Analysis: Review of the data
Runbook:Setofsteps used to analyse the data
Report:Insights

The interview process has begun, so if you believe you have the right experience then please get in touch ASAP!

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Position: Graduate Data Analyst â€“ via the Graduate Development Programme

Locations: London

Starting Salary: Â£28,000

Application Requirements:

Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) subject
Experience in analysing data
Right to work in the UK unsponsored for the duration of the programme
Ability to work on site 5 days a week.




Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants.







Grayce specialises in driving change and transformation for some of the worldâ€™s most ambitious organisations. For over a decade, we've partnered with FTSE 100 and 250 companies to deliver impactful results by developing and deploying high-performing talent in the UK and beyond.




Our Accelerated Development Programme is designed to launch the careers of recent graduates eager to make an impact. We offer a fast-track route to expertise, allowing you to gain hands-on experience with one of our impressive clients in a variety of flexible roles such as Data Analysis, InfoSec, Software Testing and DevOps.




Join Grayce and accelerate your career!

Why Grayce?

Our Analysts are actively involved in major global transformation programmes across diverse industries.

Opportunity: You'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications, whilst getting hands-on experience working full time on site directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisations.

Delivery: You will work with one client, delivering high quality outcomes during your Grayce tenure, before transitioning to working directly for them. The skills required for exceptional client delivery include natural curiosity, proactivity, adaptability, effective communication and problem solving.

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced Delivery Managers and Technical Trainers. Theyâ€™ll be your go-to, offering support, insights, sharing experiences.

Progression: Starting as an Analyst with the potential for significant salary progression, you will pick up invaluable skills and complete a minimum of 6 industry recognised accreditations during your time on the development programme.







What makes a great Grayce Analyst

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: An undergraduate degree with a minimum 2:1 within in a STEM field. A solid academic basis within data analysis and science through an additional MSc would be an advantage.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.




Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at Â£28,000 with potential for significant growth

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing

Title: Data Analyst - Pricing / Commercial
Description:
London, UK

Octopus Energy UK ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§ â€“ Data /

Full-time /

Hybrid



At Octopus, weâ€™ve led the way in innovating new ways to price energy to give customers more control over their energy costs, stamp out the loyalty penalty seen in much of the industry and engage customers to use energy when it is greenest and cheapest. Weâ€™re looking for a smart, passionate analyst to join the pricing and commercial function within our data team to help us manage and develop our energy products, and understand customer choices.

Our team takes a technology- and data-driven approach to managing our complex pricing portfolio and sales channels. We apply modern open data and analytics tools like Python, Pandas and Jupyter Notebooks to build pricing tools and customer behaviour models. Weâ€™re passionate about automating workloads and processes so we can concentrate on the interesting problems. Weâ€™re looking for someone who is equally motivated by using technology to solve problems.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work on problems that genuinely move us closer to Net Zero with a company that is passionate about building great technology and products that change the way customers use energy.

A little heads-up: With some of our team taking some well-deserved annual leave over the next couple of weeks, we may not get around to carefully reviewing all applications until the new year. Every application gets reviewed by a real human, and weâ€™ll be in touch to let you know either wayâ€”whether itâ€™s a yes or, sadly, a no this time round. Thanks for your patience and understanding!

What You'll Do...


Produce regular reports and deliver insight into sales and losses, across our different sales channels
Perform competitor and market analysis
Analyse customer switching behaviour and influences (internal e.g. tariff choice or contract renewals; and external e.g. competitor pricing or house moves)
Support operational reporting to monitor and improve growth across our acquisition channels (e.g. commissions reporting, sales incentive performance)
Execute and optimise tariff reprices according to our pricing principles
Build tools and pricing dashboards to visualise product offerings and report margins
Work closely with a broad range of teams including Cost, Procurement, Strategy, Sales and Marketing teams
Provide regulatory and policy support on switching and pricing



What You'll Need...


We donâ€™t need prior energy supplier experience (we can teach that), although experience working in energy retail is a bonus.
Ideally 2 years of professional experience
To be passionate about working in energy and contributing to the energy transition
To be curious and self-driven - when faced with a new problem is capable of seeking out an answer without lots of help and support
To be highly data literate and numerate - can make sense of lots of data and shape it into a coherent story
To have great attention to detail
To communicate complex ideas clearly



You will also need to have experience with some of the below technologies:


A scripting language (ideally Python with pandas)
Wrangling data outside of a spreadsheet environment
Writing performant queries in SQL / dbt
Building reports and dashboards in a BI tool (ideally Tableau or Streamlit)
To be passionate about building robust and useable tools



If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you.

Are you ready for a career with us? We want to ensure you have all the tools and environment you need to unleash your potential. Need any specific accommodations? Whether you require specific accommodations or have a unique preference, let us know, and we'll do what we can to customise your interview process for comfort and maximum magic!

Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic. Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work on problems that genuinely move us closer to Net Zero with a company that is passionate about building great technology and products that change the way customers use energy.

A little heads-up: With some of our team taking some well-deserved annual leave over the next couple of weeks, we may not get around to carefully reviewing all applications until the new year. Every application gets reviewed by a real human, and weâ€™ll be in touch to let you know either wayâ€”whether itâ€™s a yes or, sadly, a no this time round. Thanks for your patience and understanding!

What You'll Do...

  • Produce regular reports and deliver insight into sales and losses, across our different sales channels
  • Perform competitor and market analysis
  • Analyse customer switching behaviour and influences (internal e.g. tariff choice or contract renewals; and external e.g. competitor pricing or house moves)
  • Support operational reporting to monitor and improve growth across our acquisition channels (e.g. commissions reporting, sales incentive performance)
  • Execute and optimise tariff reprices according to our pricing principles
  • Build tools and pricing dashboards to visualise product offerings and report margins
  • Work closely with a broad range of teams including Cost, Procurement, Strategy, Sales and Marketing teams
  • Provide regulatory and policy support on switching and pricing


What You'll Need...

  • We donâ€™t need prior energy supplier experience (we can teach that), although experience working in energy retail is a bonus.
  • Ideally 2 years of professional experience
  • To be passionate about working in energy and contributing to the energy transition
  • To be curious and self-driven - when faced with a new problem is capable of seeking out an answer without lots of help and support
  • To be highly data literate and numerate - can make sense of lots of data and shape it into a coherent story
  • To have great attention to detail
  • To communicate complex ideas clearly


You will also need to have experience with some of the below technologies:

  • A scripting language (ideally Python with pandas)
  • Wrangling data outside of a spreadsheet environment
  • Writing performant queries in SQL / dbt
  • Building reports and dashboards in a BI tool (ideally Tableau or Streamlit)
  • To be passionate about building robust and useable tools


If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you.

Are you ready for a career with us? We want to ensure you have all the tools and environment you need to unleash your potential. Need any specific accommodations? Whether you require specific accommodations or have a unique preference, let us know, and we'll do what we can to customise your interview process for comfort and maximum magic!

Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic. Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Team UK

Hybrid in London, United Kingdom

Weâ€™re looking for a Data Analyst

We are looking for a Data Analyst who can help us manage our portfolio risk, support our growth plans and help even more small and medium-sized businesses in the UK market.

The Company

Fast, flexible finance empowers small businesses to manage their cash flow better and seize opportunities - making their business and the economy stronger as a whole. At iwoca, we do just that. We help businesses get the funds they need, when they need it, often within minutes. Weâ€™ve already made several billion in funding available to more than 100,000 businesses since we launched in 2012, and positioned ourselves as a leading Fintech in Europe.

Our mission is to finance one million businesses. Weâ€™ll get there by continuing to make our finance ever more relevant and accessible to more businesses by combining cutting-edge technology, data science, and a 5-star customer service

The role

Analytics and Portfolio Management:


Leading analytics efforts to assess lending book risk, inform strategy decisions and ensuring robust monitoring processes are in place to follow up on strategic changes.
Supporting governance framework establishment for risk management and adherence to business objectives.
Partnering with stakeholders to provide credit risk expertise for cross-functional projects.


Data Science Integration and Reporting:


Developing and maintaining reporting dashboards to provide clear insights into lending status.
Collaborating closely with the data science teams to enhance credit monitoring and analysis
Working with credit scoring infrastructure, eligibility criteria and credit scoring models


Collaboration and Impactful Change:


Engaging in diverse, fast-paced projects to learn and drive impactful changes.
Daily tasks encompass problem discovery, data analysis, and solution generation for risk strategy enhancements.
Close collaboration with Credit Analysts, Data Scientists, team leaders, senior management, and stakeholders from different business units.


The team

The Portfolio Risk Team plays a crucial role in the success of iwoca. They develop our monitoring systems to ensure that we remain within desired risk appetite levels, enable enhancements in the use of risk scores, and collaborate with a variety of stakeholders to facilitate new product initiatives.

The Requirements

Essential:


Strong numerate background, i.e. maths, physics, statistics, computer science, or similar.
Ability to analyse and interpret data to provide insights and support decision-making.
Team player with a fine balance of confidence, gravitas, humility, and enthusiasm: you will work with various stakeholders to get stuff done in a rapidly growing environment.
Fluent in English, both written and verbal communication.


Bonus:


A natural curiosity to spot, break down and resolve problems.
SQL and Python coding skills.
Data Visualisation tools such as Looker.
B2B or B2C credit risk lending & strategy experience.


The salary

We expect to pay from Â£35,000 - Â£50,000 for this role. But, weâ€™re open-minded, so definitely include your salary goals with your application. We routinely benchmark salaries against market rates, and run quarterly performance and salary reviews.

The culture

At iwoca, we prioritise a culture of learning, growth, and support, and invest in the professional development of our team members. We value thought and skill diversity, and encourage you to explore new areas of interest to help us innovate and improve our products and services.

The offices

We put a lot of effort into making iwoca a brilliant place to work:


Offices in London, Leeds, and Frankfurt with plenty of drinks and snacks.
Events and clubs, like bingo, comedy nights, yoga classes, football, etc.


The Benefits


Medical insurance from Vitality, including discounted gym membership, and a private GP service for you, your partner, and your dependents.
25 daysâ€™ holiday, an extra day off for your birthday, the option to buy or sell an additional 5 days of annual leave, unlimited unpaid leave, and one-month fully paid sabbatical after 4 years.
Instant access to emotional and mental health support with our partner, Spill.
Pension and share options.
Generous parental leave and a nursery tax benefit scheme to help you save money.
Paid volunteering day to support your chosen charity.
Cycle-to-work scheme and electric car scheme.
Two company retreats a year, weâ€™ve been to France, Italy, Spain and further afield.


And to make sure we all keep learning, we offer:


A learning and development budget for everyone.
Company-wide talks with internal and external speakers.
Access to learning platforms like Treehouse.


Useful links:


iwoca benefits & policies
Interview welcome pack


Compensation Range: Â£35K - Â£50K

Title: Data Analyst, UK
Description:
At Boundless Learning we are empowering our partners to deliver exceptional experiences that expand opportunities for learners around the world. We put learner success at the heart of everything we do, empowering our partners to deliver personalized, learner-centric experiences that boost access and create economic mobility. For 30 years, we've partnered with organizations and corporations around the world to design workforce-aligned experiences. When it comes to online program management, we keep learner success at the heart of everything we do and work hard to deliver positive career outcomes. At Boundless Learning youâ€™ll have the opportunity to collaborate with passionate, diverse teams, where your ideas are valued, and your expertise is respected. Join us on this meaningful journey towards transforming education and making a lasting difference in the lives of learners worldwide.




Summary

The Data and Analytics team is a nimble and highly impactful team that provides critical guidance, insights and strategic frameworks to the senior leaders responsible for various functions and business units. As an integral part of the team, the Data Analyst will help extract meaning from large volumes of data necessary to make informed business decisions and help set business vision, strategy and roadmap, through that data analysis. The Data Analyst will focus on all things analytics, including business intelligence tools, multidimensional datasets, and partnering with business leaders to answer business questions. They are responsible for requirements gathering, report design/authoring, ad-hoc analysis, quality assurance and documenting artifacts related to the report development lifecycle. Additionally, the Data Analyst utilizes strong business and technical knowledge to ensure the highest level of service and efficiency for the customer.




General Responsibilities

Specific duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following. Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned.

Execute the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.
Translate general reporting requests from the business into data requirements, acquire data from multiple sources, and develop reports to satisfy the immediate business need, with a strategic focus on anticipating future needs.
Work with business partners to translate data related questions into structured analyses and share findings of analyses in a concise and persuasive manner. â€¢ Develop business requirements and process documentation for ad-hoc, on demand, and standard reports.
Build dashboards to measure, track and interpret company KPIs/OKRâ€™s, and identify deviations from objectives.
Leverage sufficient understanding of the business and strategy to provide business recommendations to business units including (but not limited to) Marketing, Business Development, Recruitment Teams, Student Support, Partnerships and Finance.
Collaborate within a team environment to develop relevant and repeatable policies and procedures for preparing business reports and departmental processes.
Define the data elements and data structure that our team should leverage to enable analytical and reporting capabilities for our business development team.
Work with engineering and data warehouse to appropriately capture and store key data points.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.




General Qualifications.

Four (4) years of experience in designing and authoring reports/dashboards using Tableau (or similar tools like Looker, Power BI, Qlik) is required.
Four (4) years of experience writing complex queries using SQL (Preferably Google Big Query).
Experience with Salesforce is highly desired.
Any prior experience with Data Science languages like Python, and/or R is preferred.
Ability to work within a cross-functional team setting and shifting priorities.
Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to interact with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning organizational levels.
Demonstrated ability to use discretion and make sound decisions.




Supervisory Responsibilities

None.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Experience within energy power markets?




You'll be working across the company's suite of short-term forecasting tools, which has been built by a combination of machine-learning, optimisation and fundamental models within the short-term trading space.




The team is at the forefront of the energy revolution, driving innovation to power a sustainable future. Delivering reliable, affordable, and clean energy solutions to customers while reducing our environmental footprint.




The business is already a well established leader within their domain. However, they like to keep team sizes quite small as they want people to have a major say and influence on projects.




Role Overview:

Coding knowledge, in C#, Python or another equivalent language
Experience of the energy power markets
An appetite for problem-solving, turning real-world challenges into impactful tools
Interpersonal, organisational and project management skills
Writing, data analysis and presentation skills




Key Responsibilities:

Data Collection & Management:
Gather, clean, and organize large sets of energy market data (including pricing, volumes, weather data, and economic indicators) from internal and external sources.
Market Analysis:
Analyze market trends, price movements, and trade activity to provide insights that inform trading strategies and operational decisions.
Reporting & Visualization:
Create detailed reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate complex data in an easily understandable format for internal stakeholders.
Predictive Modeling & Forecasting:
Develop and maintain statistical models to forecast energy prices, demand fluctuations, and other key metrics using historical data.
Collaboration with Traders & Analysts:
Work closely with traders, risk managers, and other analysts to provide real-time insights and data-driven recommendations to improve trading strategies and market positioning.
Automation & Process Improvement:
Identify opportunities to automate data collection, reporting, and analysis processes to increase efficiency and reduce manual workloads.
Compliance & Risk Management:
Ensure all data analysis and reporting are compliant with regulatory standards and internal risk management protocols.




The successful Data Analyst will earn up to Â£50,000 and in addition there are exceptional benefits which come as part of the overall package including: 15% Bonus, 8% Pension contribution, training fund, weekly team lunches, travel loans and numerous soft leisurely benefits. The team tends to come together 2 days a week for some collaboration, but only when it adds value to do so.




Spencer Scott Ltd is an equal opportunity Recruitment Agency, which means we do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression. We celebrate diversity and are committed to create inclusive working environments for all our clients.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data & Reporting Analyst - FTC 6 months




Job Summary

The Data & Reporting Analyst will play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making within our UK & ROI sales business. This individual will be responsible for assessing, cleansing, and consolidating our existing data sources to create comprehensive, actionable reports and dashboards. By leveraging their expertise in SQL, BI software (particularly Power BI), and SAP, the Analyst will provide valuable insights to senior leadership to optimize performance and inform strategic initiatives.




Key Responsibilities

Data Assessment and Consolidation:

Conduct a thorough evaluation of existing data sources, identifying gaps, inconsistencies, and quality issues.

Develop strategies to cleanse, standardize, and consolidate data from various sources (e.g., CRM, ERP, sales data, market data).

Design and implement robust data governance processes to ensure data accuracy and integrity.

Reporting and Analytics:

Create and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards using Power BI and Excel to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and monitor sales performance.

Develop advanced analytical models to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities within the UK & ROI market.

Provide actionable insights and recommendations to senior leadership based on data analysis.

Data Integration and Modelling:

Integrate data from multiple sources to create a unified data warehouse or data mart.

Develop data models and visualizations that effectively communicate complex information to stakeholders.

Change Management and Product Management:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven initiatives and promote a data-centric culture.

Manage the implementation of new data tools and processes, ensuring successful adoption and user acceptance.




Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field.

3+ years of experience in a data analysis or business intelligence role.

Proven expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Excel.

Strong understanding of data warehousing and data modelling concepts.

Experience working with SAP systems (preferred).

Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and data visualization best practices.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Experience in change management or product management (advantageous).

Additional Skills (Desired)

Experience with Python or R programming languages.

Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).

Knowledge of dental industry trends and dynamics.




By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to contribute significantly to the growth and success of our UK & ROI sales business. Your analytical skills and ability to leverage data will be instrumental in driving informed decision-making and achieving our strategic objectives.




You'll experience the spirit of an international and innovative market leader in the dental industry. Besides an attractive remuneration package, you will also be eligible for a variety of employee benefits, such as:

26 days' annual leave, an attractive company pension scheme and a flexible benefit scheme ( including health insurance, dental cover, medical cash planâ€¦).

We attach great importance to your development: a comprehensive induction, further training opportunities and access to LinkedIn Learning are available to you. Take advantage of personal and professional development opportunities through our worldwide mentoring and coaching program. In addition, we offer an extensive, global employee assistance program that provides a wide range of benefits as well as retirement benefits.

HTML:
Data & Reporting Analyst - FTC 6 months


Job Summary

The Data & Reporting Analyst will play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making within our UK & ROI sales business. This individual will be responsible for assessing, cleansing, and consolidating our existing data sources to create comprehensive, actionable reports and dashboards. By leveraging their expertise in SQL, BI software (particularly Power BI), and SAP, the Analyst will provide valuable insights to senior leadership to optimize performance and inform strategic initiatives.


Key Responsibilities

Data Assessment and Consolidation:

Conduct a thorough evaluation of existing data sources, identifying gaps, inconsistencies, and quality issues.

Develop strategies to cleanse, standardize, and consolidate data from various sources (e.g., CRM, ERP, sales data, market data).

Design and implement robust data governance processes to ensure data accuracy and integrity.

Reporting and Analytics:

Create and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards using Power BI and Excel to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and monitor sales performance.

Develop advanced analytical models to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities within the UK & ROI market.

Provide actionable insights and recommendations to senior leadership based on data analysis.

Data Integration and Modelling:

Integrate data from multiple sources to create a unified data warehouse or data mart.

Develop data models and visualizations that effectively communicate complex information to stakeholders.

Change Management and Product Management:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven initiatives and promote a data-centric culture.

Manage the implementation of new data tools and processes, ensuring successful adoption and user acceptance.


Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field.

3+ years of experience in a data analysis or business intelligence role.

Proven expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Excel.

Strong understanding of data warehousing and data modelling concepts.

Experience working with SAP systems (preferred).

Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and data visualization best practices.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Experience in change management or product management (advantageous).

Additional Skills (Desired)

Experience with Python or R programming languages.

Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).

Knowledge of dental industry trends and dynamics.


By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to contribute significantly to the growth and success of our UK & ROI sales business. Your analytical skills and ability to leverage data will be instrumental in driving informed decision-making and achieving our strategic objectives.


You'll experience the spirit of an international and innovative market leader in the dental industry. Besides an attractive remuneration package, you will also be eligible for a variety of employee benefits, such as:

26 days' annual leave, an attractive company pension scheme and a flexible benefit scheme ( including health insurance, dental cover, medical cash planâ€¦).

We attach great importance to your development: a comprehensive induction, further training opportunities and access to LinkedIn Learning are available to you. Take advantage of personal and professional development opportunities through our worldwide mentoring and coaching program. In addition, we offer an extensive, global employee assistance program that provides a wide range of benefits as well as retirement benefits.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Client: world-leading media conglomerate

Duration: 6 months with possible extension

Pay rate: negotiable (PAYE or Umbrella - Inside IR35)

Work type: remote, with occasional visit to the Leavesden studio




Who are the GO-Tech team?

GO-Tech (Global Operations Technologies) are part of the company's Technology group and are responsible for the software and hardware solutions which run physical operations, globally. Their area of focus encompasses four main pillars:

Tours & Retail
Studio Operations
Physical Security
Global Real Estate




This role sits within the Physical Security pillar, which supports the security systems including Access Control, CCTV, and Threat Monitoring, throughout locations worldwide.




The Role

The Data Analyst will play a key role in the success of a major global project currently in-flight. The primary objective of this position is to analyse, understand, and devise a method for matching our core employee master data with employee data spread across multiple diverse data sources.




As this data will be imported into a new system, itâ€™s imperative that we have a single unique record for each employee in the database, but the unstructured and diverse nature of the data sources mean this will be a complex and challenging activity.




This is a hands-on role and will require somebody with a strong appreciation of databases, scripting, and/or macros to automate as much as possible of the data mapping activity. There will also be a significant manual element to this activity, which will require careful judgement and attention to detail while working through large data sets.




This a great opportunity to provide substantial value to a highly visible project.




Key Responsibilities

Take ownership of the datasets.
Devise methods for matching on suitable attributes.
Update the source data sets with unique employee IDs for every employee.
Document and share your findings with other team members, including appropriate external vendors.
Proactively highlight issues and concerns to the project team.
Collaborate with application and database teams to prepare the source datasets.
Provide regular status updates, including progress reports, identified risks, issues and concerns.




About You

As a Data Analyst, you will be passionate about your work and problem solving, with a motivation to deliver results quickly and effectively.
Proven prior experience in successfully analysing and manipulating large data sets.
Knowledge of SQL, Excel Macros, and other scripting tools.
Passionate about your work and problem solving, flexible, resilient, driven and committed. Exhibiting a strong team orientation, with an innately proactive and not reactive approach to work.
Highly self-motivated, reliable & able to work with limited supervision.




We are committed to creating both a workforce and content that are as diverse as the global audiences we serve. See what we are doing for Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging: https://www.warnermediagroup.com/diversity

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid/Remote options available)

About The Role

We are seeking a talented and experienced Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for turning complex data into actionable insights, helping to drive strategic decisions within the company. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to improve operational efficiency.

Key Responsibilities


Data Analysis: Analyse large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights that will inform business strategy, content planning, and marketing campaigns.
Dashboard Development: Create and maintain interactive dashboards and visual reports using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker Studio.
Technical Data Queries: Write SQL queries to extract, clean, and analyse data from multiple sources, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Statistical Modelling: Use tools such as Python, R, or other statistical programming languages to perform deeper analysis, build models, and run simulations.
Collaboration: Work with content, marketing, and product teams to deliver insights that drive performance improvements across various business functions.
Stakeholder Reporting: Present findings in a clear and impactful way to senior management and other stakeholders.


Key Qualifications And Skills


Previous experience in a data analyst role within the digital media, or telecommunications industries is highly desirable, although candidates from other data-driven sectors may also be considered.
Proficiency in Data Visualisation: Strong experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker Studio to communicate insights clearly and effectively.
Technical Expertise: Familiarity with SQL for querying large datasets, as well as proficiency in Python, R, or other statistical programming languages for data analysis and modelling.


Quantitative Expertise: Strong background in quantitative analysis, statistics, or data science, with proven ability to apply these techniques to real-world business problems

No sponsorship available. Please send me your updated CV to

Title: Data Insight Analyst
Description:
The Company

Christieâ€™s, the worldâ€™s largest Art Business, is an incredibly exciting & enriching place to start or continue your career. Whether you work within one of our Specialist Art Departments, or in one of our more Operational teams, we are all working together with one common goal in mind: to continue the success of this 250 year old company, steeped in history, bringing fresh ideas whilst not forgetting our shared values; Integrity, Excellence, Innovation, Responsibility & Relationships. Colleagues across all departments are truly passionate about what they do and it is inspiring to work with industry leaders across our business.â€¯

Why This Role Matters

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Insights Analyst to join our dynamic Data and Insights team. This is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to grow their career in data analytics and gain hands-on experience in a collaborative and innovative environment.

How You'll Make An Impact


Write Queries:â€¯Develop and execute SQL queries to extract and analyse data from various sources.
Build Tableau Dashboards:â€¯Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Tableau to provide actionable insights.
Data Preparation:â€¯Prepare and clean data for analysis by reclassifying and organizing datasets. Leverage several data sources like transactional and customer databases to bring together data for analysis
Analysis and Visualization:â€¯Perform data analysis and create visualizations to support team reporting.
Data Checks:â€¯Perform data reconciliation and validation checks to ensure data integrity
Testing / QA:â€¯Participate in testing and quality assurance processes as part of data migration projects.


What Youâ€™ll Bring To The Team


Bachelor's degree in; Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or BI.
Experience in leveraging cloud services (AWS/Azure) and interacting with a Data Lake environment an advantage.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Ralph Lauren Corporation (NYSE:RL) is a global leader in the design, marketing and distribution of premium lifestyle products in five categories: apparel, accessories, home, fragrances, and hospitality. For more than 50 years, Ralph Lauren's reputation and distinctive image have been consistently developed across an expanding number of products, brands and international markets. The Company's brand names, which include Ralph Lauren, Ralph Lauren Collection, Ralph Lauren Purple Label, Polo Ralph Lauren, Double RL, Lauren Ralph Lauren, Polo Ralph Lauren Children, Chaps, among others, constitute one of the world's most widely recognized families of consumer brands.

At Ralph Lauren, we unite and inspire the communities within our company as well as those in which we serve by amplifying voices and perspectives to create a culture of belonging, ensuring inclusion, and fairness for all. We foster a culture of inclusion through: Talent, Education & Communication, Employee Groups and Celebration.


Key role in the EMEA E-commerce analytics team ensuring they will drive automating and creating the digital customer reports on a recurring basis for E-commerce to support Business Strategy. They will lead on enhancing the E-commerce DataMart encompassing data from various data sources to unlock, drive and deliver new insights, reporting, and advanced analytics to drive data driven business decisions. They will lead on solving complex business problems / challenges through data & web analytics and will story-tell the actionable insights to the key stakeholders to drive and encourage data-driven decision making. They will become an SME for two areas in E-commerce and will own and maintain that dialogue whilst also pro-actively delivering innovative and creative analytics in that space. They will build and collaborate with various business teams outside of E-commerce to drive new data initiatives. They will upskill /mentor the team in the new tools (i.e. Tableau) to expand the knowledge of the whole team.
Drive critical workflows for transforming, visualising, and extracting value from E-commerce
Lead on designing and developing automated reports using SQL and Tableau to surface insights to the entire business and also drive self-serve analytics within E-commerce
Collect and analyse data from various data sources, including website data, sales data, customer data and feedback, to identify trends and insights related to customer behaviour, product performance and market dynamics.
Lead on quantitative, transactional based analysis: specific profile, segment, channel or store performance analysis from a customer standpoint to support the understanding of new Business challenges
Lead on qualitative based analysis: find additional possible explanations for Business challenges within the current set of qualitative feedback from customers and browsers
Insights and Analysis presentations: develop and deliver clear, insightful, and high-quality story-telling power point presentations to be shared with wider teams and key stakeholders
You will collaborate with various business teams to drive new data initiatives within the E-commerce analytics team
Pro-actively contribute to the wider departmental outputs.
Mentor analysts within the team
Key KPIs:
Deliver data analysis and actionable insights through storytelling
Deliver analytics actions within wider business projects
Build critical data workflows to combine multiple data sources
Lead smaller analytical projects from discovery to output delivery
Power-user of SQL/Python, Dataiku & Tableau


Experience, Skills & Knowledge


Tools/Software
SQL &/Python
Dataiku
Tableau
Adobe
Microstrategy (nice to have)
Show more

Title: Data Insights Analyst, SQL, Power BI, Mainly Remote
Description:
Data Insight Analyst, Power BI, DAX, Power Query, SQL, Remote

Data Insight Analyst required to work for a fast growing company in Central London. However, this is a remote role and you will only have to pop into the office circa once a month.

The skills re Power BI, Power Query and SQL are extremely important, but so is the character / personality of the individual. You, as the Data Insight Analyst, will apply your experience of driving growth through data to the company, which is fast growing and constantly ever changing. Data and technology are at the heart of their proposition and transformation. The value you will bring is key to realising the organisations potential.

Your focus will be on the KPIs of the business and making the data easily accessible enough for weekly board meetings, so the information can be used in order to help the overall performance of the business.

In summary, we are looking for someone who has the technical Power BI and SQL server skills, great communication to be able to discuss results / findings at c-suite level and be able to go and independently investigate the meaning behind a Key Performance Indicator (KPI) to report back.

There are 3 things they absolutely need you to have experience of:


Evidence of being inquisitive. Asking for information in order to obtain the information you need to help empower your role
Building Reports using Power BI and / or Microsoft SQL / Azure SQL
Forecasting having a pipeline of where the journey is going and clear visibility it is all heading in a positive direction


Read on for more details

Essential


Strong data analysis experience,
Advanced technical skills including Power BI, DAX, Power Query,
Excel and other MS Office applications.
Advance SQL querying, ideally Microsoft (SQL Server) T-SQL.
Meticulous attention to detail.
The ability to communicate effectively, both written and orally.
Team player who can work proactively and on their own initiative.
Ability to work to deadlines and multi-task.
Ability to prioritise own workload and effectively manage projects.
Some Microsoft Azure exposure.


This is a great opportunity and salary is dependent upon experience. Apply now for more details.

The skills re Power BI, Power Query and SQL are extremely important, but so is the character / personality of the individual. You, as the Data Insight Analyst, will apply your experience of driving growth through data to the company, which is fast growing and constantly ever changing. Data and technology are at the heart of their proposition and transformation. The value you will bring is key to realising the organisations potential.

Your focus will be on the KPIs of the business and making the data easily accessible enough for weekly board meetings, so the information can be used in order to help the overall performance of the business.

In summary, we are looking for someone who has the technical Power BI and SQL server skills, great communication to be able to discuss results / findings at c-suite level and be able to go and independently investigate the meaning behind a Key Performance Indicator (KPI) to report back.

There are 3 things they absolutely need you to have experience of:

  • Evidence of being inquisitive. Asking for information in order to obtain the information you need to help empower your role
  • Building Reports using Power BI and / or Microsoft SQL / Azure SQL
  • Forecasting having a pipeline of where the journey is going and clear visibility it is all heading in a positive direction

Read on for more details

Essential

  • Strong data analysis experience,
  • Advanced technical skills including Power BI, DAX, Power Query,
  • Excel and other MS Office applications.
  • Advance SQL querying, ideally Microsoft (SQL Server) T-SQL.
  • Meticulous attention to detail.
  • The ability to communicate effectively, both written and orally.
  • Team player who can work proactively and on their own initiative.
  • Ability to work to deadlines and multi-task.
  • Ability to prioritise own workload and effectively manage projects.
  • Some Microsoft Azure exposure.

This is a great opportunity and salary is dependent upon experience. Apply now for more details.

Title: Fraud Data Analyst
Description:
About Us:

One-third of the UK working-age population is not able to access mainstream financial services. These people find themselves excluded from affordable credit and treated poorly by mainstream financial institutions. Too few are successfully supported on the journey to financial health. Our purpose is "To improve the nation's financial health through accessibility, affordability and community."

We are a fast-growing social FinTech company giving not-for-profit Credit Unions in the UK access to a state-of-the-art fintech. We aim to grow a select group of Community Lenders into a network of challenger banks offering a viable alternative to high-cost lenders.

We are a small and dynamic team of 250+ people, offering you the opportunity to have an immediate impact on the business and grow with us. We have over 120,000+ customers on our platform and it's increasing rapidly.

We grew significantly in size over the last year and the credit unions on our platform are the biggest players in the UK.

We have big ambitions and a management team to deliver it; with 100+ years' experience in banking across Credit Suisse, UBS, NatWest, Capital One and Barclays.

The Role:

At Amplifi, data lies at the heart of all strategies and is key to combating fraud. As a fintech in the consumer lending space we strongly believe that innovative use of data and technology are key to delivering on our strategic growth objectives. The Fraud Analyst role plays a vital role of protecting us and our customers from fraudsters allowing us to offer the best products and services to our customers.

As a Fraud Analyst, you are expected to carry out analysis of data patterns relating to fraud, assess new tool and technologies to help us combat first, second- and third-party fraud. This role will be hands-on with data, and you will work closely with other teams to develop effective solutions. You will also interact with external suppliers to assess their proposed solutions and to stay abreast of the latest trends and innovations. You will report to the Credit Risk Manager and play a key role in guiding other colleagues on best practices to prevent fraud.

Requirements:


Create, maintain and disseminate appropriate metrics for the monitoring of Fraud within the business
Work with business stakeholders to identify fraud challenges and solutions that offer the greatest opportunities to the organisation
Carry out analysis to support ongoing fraud prevention including acquisition fraud and in-life fraud
Summarise and present performance, recommendations and proposals to stakeholders up to C-level execs and external stakeholders (such as partners and investors) with actionable insights
Explore large sets of structured and unstructured data from disparate sources, including new, and unconventional ones, and come up with innovative ways of using this data. Design appropriate tests to collect additional data, if required
Provide insights on advances in fraud prevention, identifying opportunities within the business for the execution of new ideas, tools and platforms
Work with wider Data Engineering, Decision Systems, Decision Science teams to ensure proper testing, validation and deployment of data, new service and solutions
Contribute to guidelines on fraud strategy and underwriting process, ensuring practices are aligned to regulations and well documented
Support and mentor more junior colleagues



Requirements

This is a pivotal role in the analytics team of a fast-growing business and hence the ideal candidate would be someone who:


Has experience in the Consumer Credit/Lending space
Is passionate about Data, Analytics and Fraud prevention
Is self-motivated and proactive; shows ownership and initiative - Not afraid of being hands-on and possess a roll-up-your-sleeves attitude to get things done
Has excellent communication and stakeholder management skills



To be successful in the role, the candidate should:


Have at least 3 years of experience in risk analytics roles, including a significant exposure to fraud prevention projects, preferably in a consumer lending context
Have strong ability in querying and extracting insights from large datasets using SQL
Have a proven practical experience of fraud prevention technologies and techniques, including using UK bureau data (e.g. Experian, Equifax or TransUnion)
Have a solid grounding in probability and statistics
Have experience in creating data monitoring and KPIs with tools like PowerBI/Tableau or similar
Preferably have a degree in a numerate (STEM) discipline or else have equivalent skills derived from self-learning / online courses



Also Desirable:


Modelling experience, applied to Financial Services
Financial services experience, particularly consumer credit
Experience managing Proof-of-Concept projects
Experience of A/B testing
Scale-up experience



Benefits


Competitive salary
25 days annual leave
Discount shopping
Private Health Cover via Bupa
Cycle-to-Work Scheme
Subsidised Nursery scheme
Hybrid working (2 days from home)



Commitment:

We are committed to equality of opportunity for all staff and applications from individuals are encouraged regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships.

Please note that all offers of employment are conditional on us obtaining satisfactory pre-employment checks, including a DBS check, a credit check and employment references.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company:

Mercer




Description:

We are seeking a talented individual to join our Mercer Private Wealth (MPW) team as a Data Analyst based in the London office.

This is a hybrid role that has a requirement of working at least three days a week in the office

.

As a Data Analyst you will be involved in the production and development of the MI suite for the MPW business, maintenance of the MPW Intelliflo Office database and maintaining procedure documents.

You will also be assisting in the development & implementation of technological solutions for MPW to improve the overall client journey and efficiency of processes whilst working closely with the Operational Support team to ensure that a unified approach is adopted and communicated across the MPW business, in relation to procedures and processes.




We will count on you to:

Be responsible for the quality and maintenance of the Intelliflo Office (iO) data
Produce and communicate Management Information suite across the MPW business
Maintain and develop MPW templates
Assist with the Development & Implementation of additional technological solutions for the MPW business.
Assist with the design & implementation of ad hoc projects as required.




What you need to have:

Proven strong Excel skills.
Previous VBA and/or Python based experience/knowledge
Strong analytical and communication skills
Excellent planning and organisation skills

What makes you stand out?

Proven knowledge and experience working with data, along with a strong willingness to help the team learn new skills and improve the business




Why join our team:

We help you be your best through professional development opportunities, interesting work and supportive leaders.
We foster a vibrant and inclusive culture where you can work with talented colleagues to create new solutions and have impact for colleagues, clients and communities.
Our scale enables us to provide a range of career opportunities, as well as benefits and rewards to enhance your well-being.




Mercer, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a global leader in helping clients realize their investment objectives, shape the future of work and enhance health and retirement outcomes for their people. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $23 billion and more than 85,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit mercer.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.







Marsh McLennan is committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age background, civil partnership status, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, gender reassignment, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to providing reasonable adjustments in accordance with applicable law to any candidate with a disability to allow them to fully participate in the recruitment process. If you have a disability that may require reasonable adjustments, please contact us at reasonableaccommodations@mmc.com.




Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one â€œanchor dayâ€ per week on which their full team will be together in person.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

Sharegain began with one question: If the largest institutions solely exercise the right to lend their stocks, bonds, and ETFs, what would it take to unlock this revenue opportunity for every investor?




Our team of experts in the UK, US and Israel built the solution: a platform that empowers online brokers, private banks, and wealth managers to offer securities lending to their clients. We call it SLaaS: Securities Lending as a Service. Itâ€™s a fully digital, customizable, end-to-end solution that automates front- and back-office operations. Institutions and investors are now free to earn more from what they own.




Every Sharegainer has their own backstory, but we all share an ambition to do things differently â€“ bigger, better, and greater. Together weâ€™re on a mission to democratize capital markets by building a more liquid world. The more we share, the more we all gain.




About the role

We are looking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our innovative R&D data team. This role is integral in managing data analysis frameworks and infrastructure, driving data-centric decision-making, and contributing to data monitoring and management solutions. Responsibilities include designing and executing data analysis, developing interactive Power BI dashboards, optimizing SQL queries, and transforming complex datasets into actionable insights. Strong analytical skills and a deep understanding of data visualization are essential for success in this role.




Key responsibilities:

Power BI Report and Dashboard Development:

Design, develop, and maintain insightful Power BI dashboards and reports to meet business requirements.
Collaborate with product and stakeholders to gather reporting needs and translate them into technical solutions.
Create data models and implement measures, calculated columns, and other DAX functions to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Ensure reports are visually compelling and user-friendly, providing key insights at a glance.




SQL Query Writing and Optimization:

Write, optimize, and maintain complex SQL queries to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.
Develop and manage stored procedures, functions, and scripts to automate data processing and reporting tasks.
Perform regular database performance analysis and optimization to ensure efficiency.




Data Analysis and Reporting:

Provide ad-hoc reporting and data analysis based on the requests of stakeholders.




Data Quality and Governance

Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data by implementing data validation and quality checks.
Document data processes, report development, and SQL code for future reference and knowledge sharing.




Collaboration

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product, business units, and leadership, to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Train and support users and team members on using Power BI reports and dashboards.




Required skills

â€œCan do attitudeâ€
At least 3 years of expertise in Power BI, including DAX and data modelling.
Experience building and maintaining efficient sematic models.
Strong proficiency in SQL, including query optimization and stored procedure development.
Experience with data warehousing and data mart concepts.
Knowledge and experience building data pipelines (ETL) (advantageous).
Hands-on experience working with Azure Synapse Analytics/Fabric (advantageous).
Understanding and professional experience in financial markets and instruments (shares, ETFs, bonds) (advantageous).
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and present insights effectively.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively with stakeholders.
Thrive as a collaborative team player, seamlessly integrating with diverse R&D teams both domestically and internationally.
Excel in communication, with a knack for conveying complex ideas effectively.







Sharegain is an equal opportunity employer. Employees and contractors, as well as prospective employees and contractors, will all be treated equally and fairly. We are passionate in our belief that a diverse workforce is central to our success, and we are proud to reflect this within our recruiting processes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title - Data Analyst

Location - Oxford (Hybrid)

About The Client

We are working with an established, well-funded AI drug discovery company at the forefront of revolutionising how treatments are discovered, tested, and developed. With a growing presence worldwide, they're expanding their Oxford-based AI & Data team and looking for talented individuals passionate about combining data with life sciences to fuel breakthroughs in drug discovery, climate change, sustainable agriculture and government innovation.

Role Overview

The data analyst must have a love for attention to detail and be excited by data management. This is a hands-on role but will also contribute to strategic acquisition and platform positions, supporting business growth and decision-making. You will join an industry-leading team of AI researchers, applied AI scientists, and data and software engineers with a real passion for building a better tomorrow for us all.

The ideal candidate will have strong analytical capabilities with deep industry experience and the ability to bridge the gap between business context and data analysis. As we are building out the team from scratch, we are open to speaking to candidates with varying levels of experience so please apply if your experience aligns with the requirements listed below.

This is an incredibly unique opportunity to join a technology institute, on a mission to build sustainable change in the world, through accelerating innovation by driving scientific and technological advancements.

Responsibilities


Design, implement and optimise data collection processes to gather relevant and high-quality data for various projects within the domains of climate tech, health, energy, sustainable farming
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data is accurately captured from multiple sources, including experimental, clinical, and public datasets
Assess data quality and establish robust data validation procedures to ensure data integrity throughout the analysis pipeline
Develop and apply data quality frameworks tailored to machine learning use cases, focusing on data completeness, accuracy, and reliability
Act as a vital link between engineers, scientists, and the applied AI team, facilitating seamless communication and data flow across the entire drug discovery process
Support interdisciplinary projects by translating complex data requirements into actionable insights and providing clear guidance on data use
Guide the data acquisition strategy based on a comprehensive understanding of industry dynamics, emerging trends, and scientific advancements
Identify new data sources and partnerships that can enhance the company's data capabilities and contribute to strategic decision-making


Requirements


Bachelor's or Master's in Data Science, Statistics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, or a related field. A PhD is a plus
Minimum of 3 years of experience as a data analyst within an elite organisation
Proven track record in handling complex datasets, particularly in the context of drug discovery, biomedical research, agriculture, clean energy, government
Proficiency in data analysis and manipulation tools such as Python, R, and SQL
Experience with data visualisation platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to effectively communicate insights to stakeholders
Experience with data visualisation platforms (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and data quality assessment techniques
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to translate complex data insights for non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying and addressing data-related challenges


What's On Offer


Industry-leading salary compensation DOE
An opportunity to work on projects that will make a difference in the world, all projects are multi-decade programs that are orientated to improve society and people's lives
A rare opportunity to shape and lead the AI Capability team from the ground up
State-of-the-art resources, enabling you to push the boundaries of AI research and development quickly and ethically


If you're a data-driven professional passionate about innovation and real-world impact, we encourage you to apply!

Title: HR Systems and Data Analyst
Description:
WHO WE ARE:




Peninsula is the leading provider of marine energy services and solutions globally.

For the last 25 years, we have positioned ourselves as the benchmark for quality in our industry.

We offer local knowledge on a global scale.




We are an experienced team of individuals who work collectively to meet all of our customer demands and needs. Having forged close relationships with our customers, our solutions are developed and driven by them. We have the ability to control our entire supply chain and thus offer quality products and services that are unique in todayâ€™s market.




Our reputation for transparency and a low risk tolerance, together with the highest standards of corporate governance and sanctions adherence, have combined to secure strong support for the group in financial and insurance markets.




WHAT YOUâ€™LL DO:




The Systems & Data Analyst will be responsible for end to end HR systems and data management. Including new systems, requirements capture, analysis, design and implementation and optimisation of current HR systems. Reporting, analysis and interpretation of data, identifying trends to inform and support key decision making and leading data quality improvements.




A high level of data analytics as well as technical strength to work with multiple data sources will be required to succeed in this position, ideally with experience in an HR function.










MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES




Working with HR colleagues and stakeholders to translate business requirements into detailed system requirement documents and/or user stories that will either be used by our in-house software development team or by 3rd party organisations working on our behalf
System upgrades, implementations and ongoing development
Design, document and configure HR system workflows and efficient HR system processes
Make recommendations for system and data improvements based on industry trends and professional business knowledge
Creation of KPI dashboard for HR department and stakeholders
Analysis, design and implementation of new systems ensuring functionality or performance is not lost and new requirements are met
Enhance the automated connectivity and integrations between Peninsulaâ€™s in house systems to reduce manual process
Working with Operational Risk to ensure that existing business processes are maintained and any risks are reduced
Development of data flow diagrams and business process diagrams (current and future state)
Document problems / requirements and proposed solutions as part of a functional specification in line with company standards
Support continuous improvement initiatives across all HR data and systems, including design, configuration, testing and implementation.
Perform analytical testing and investigative work, assisting with the resolution of application support and maintenance issues where relevant
Produce technical documentation (Requirements Specification, Test Plan, Process Mapping and Data Flows)
Create and maintain user manuals, guides and other communication documentation for internal stakeholders/vendors
Manage system access permissions access ensuring sufficient segregation of duties
Improve training and operational procedures within business to increase efficiency and productivity
Identify data and reporting issues through analysing raw data and reports, identifying trends, gaps and inconsistencies.
Working with wider HR team to correct the data and identify root cause of the issues and how these can be mitigated in future
Developing regular reporting and data packs for HR and executive team members to support business decision making
Lead on data compliance ensuring data legislation guidelines are met, such as GDPR retention rules







KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE




Strong experience of HR systems, data and reporting; ideally understanding global challenges and solutions
Highly developed end to end project management skills
Advanced Power BI, Excel and Pivot Table skills
Excellent analytical skills and very high attention to detail
Strong troubleshooting, root cause analysis and problem-solving skills with high levels of attention to detail
Knowledge of system integration and the analysis needed to implement them
Good understanding of the principles of information security and segregation of duties
Actively share knowledge with the team and become an expert on data and processes,
Ability to work as part of a team and on own initiative in a constructive manner
Flexible, self-motivated and proactive
Excellent time management skills and ability to work on multiple projects at once, using strong time management skills and prioritisation
Ability to recommend practical ways using innovation, good judgement, creativity and strategic thinking
Excellent oral and written communication skills
External vendor management and selection skills
Negotiation, difficult conversation management and prioritisation skills

Perm role, hybrid working, salary up to Â£50k + bonus & benefits
